The final chapter ([link]ch. 34[/link]) was probably written by someone other than Moses.
Approximately 1452 B.C., before the end of Israel's wandering in the wilderness for forty years ([link]Num. 32:13[/link]).
The last two months of 1452 B.C., the fortieth year after the exodus from Egypt ([link]1:3[/link]; [link]34:8[/link]).

verse.text: [note]1[/note]These are the words which [note]2[/note]Moses spoke to all Israel across the Jordan in the wilderness, in the [note]3[/note]Arabah opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
verse.note: Deuteronomy is a concluding word of the law and gives an all-inclusive conclusion to the Pentateuch, the first five books of the Bible, which were written by Moses. [i]Deuteronomy[/i] means [i]second law[/i] and thus signifies a respeaking, a repeated speaking, of the divine law. The law was given through Moses the first time when he was eighty ([link]Exo. 7:7[/link]). Forty years later, after the first generation, with the exception of Caleb and Joshua, had died out, the law was spoken again to the children of Israel, this time to the second generation, the generation that was ready to enter into the good land and possess it. Most of that generation had not been present to hear the giving of the Ten Commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances at Mount Sinai. Therefore, God burdened Moses to respeak, to rehearse, the law. This respeaking was a renewed training given to the new generation of the children of Israel after their long wandering, to prepare them to enter into the good land promised by God and inherit it as their possession.[br][br]In this book, as in the entire Bible, God is manifested, man is exposed, and Christ is unveiled. This book speaks of God as a God of love, righteousness, faithfulness, and blessing that man may know God's heart and God's government and may love God, trust in God, fear God, subject himself to God's ruling, mind the tender feelings of God, and live in the presence of God that he may be qualified to inherit the promised land. Furthermore, it exposes man, showing that in himself man is a failure, absolutely unable to fulfill the requirements of the holy, righteous, and faithful God, so that man may know his real condition and have no confidence in himself but put his trust in God, the One who is faithful ([link]7:9[/link]). Finally, this book unveils Christ in three aspects: (1) as the unique Prophet of God, as the divine oracle ([link]18:15-19[/link]); (2) as the all-inclusive good land, the goal, the aim, prepared for us by God ([link]8:7-10[/link]; [link]Col. 1:12[/link]; [link]Phil. 3:7-15[/link]); and (3) as the word of God ([link]8:3[/link]; [link]30:11-14[/link]; [link]John 1:1[/link]; [link]1 John 1:1[/link]) that we may receive Him as our life and our life supply and thus have the strength and ability to reach Him as the God-appointed goal. See notes [link book="Deut." chapter="8"]3[sup]1[/sup][/link] and [link]7[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link] and note [link]12[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 30[/link].

In Deuteronomy Moses as the spokesman of God was like an aged, loving father speaking to his children with much love and concern. Moses spoke for God for forty years, from the age of eighty ([link]Exo. 7:7[/link]) to the age of one hundred twenty ([link]34:7[/link]). He was a person not only soaked and saturated with the thought of God but also constituted with the speaking God Himself. Hence, the word that proceeded out of his mouth was the word of God. See notes [link]3[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link] and [link]12[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 30[/link].
I.e., the plain that runs from north of the Dead Sea south to the Gulf of Aqaba.

verse.text: It is eleven days' [i]journey[/i] from [note]1[/note]Horeb to Kadesh-barnea by the way [i]that leads[/i] to Mount Seir.
verse.note: See note [link]11[sup]2[/sup] in Exo. 19[/link].

verse.text: And in the fortieth year, in the eleventh month, on the [xref]a[/xref]first day of the month, Moses spoke to the children of Israel according to all that Jehovah had commanded him for them,
After he had slain [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Sihon the king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, and [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]Og the king of Bashan, who dwelt in Ashtaroth [i]and[/i] in Edrei.
verse.note: See note [link]1[sup]2[/sup] in Num. 21[/link]. The slaying of these two kings was near the end of the forty years ([link]v. 3[/link]) of Israel's wandering in the wilderness. It also opened the gate into the promised land.

chapter.verse: Across the Jordan, in the land of Moab, Moses set himself to expound this law, saying,

verse.text: [note]1[/note]Jehovah our God [xref]a[/xref]spoke to us at [xref]b[/xref]Horeb, saying, You have dwelt long enough at this mountain.
verse.note: With a review of the past, on the one hand, this book points out God's leading that man may know the heart and the hand of God, so that man may trust in God and fear God; on the other hand, it points out man's failure that man may know himself, condemn the flesh, and learn how to reject the self and the flesh. With a view of the future, this book expects that, on the one hand, man may know the love and government of God and that, on the other hand, man may know his real condition, so that he will no longer trust in himself but will trust in God, the faithful One.

verse.text: Turn and set out, and go to the hill country of the Amorites and to all their neighboring peoples in the Arabah, in the hill country and in the lowland, and in the [note]1[/note]Negev and by the seacoast, the land of the Canaanites and Lebanon, as far as the great river, the river [xref]a[/xref]Euphrates.
verse.note: I.e., the dry southern desert of Canaan.

verse.text: See, I have set the land before you; go in and possess the land which Jehovah swore to give to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to them and to their [xref]a[/xref]seed after them.
And I spoke to you at that time, saying, [xref]a[/xref]I am not able to bear you alone.
Jehovah your God has multiplied you, and now today you are as the [xref]a[/xref]stars of heaven in multitude.

chapter.verse: Jehovah, the God of your fathers, add to you a thousandfold [i]ones[/i] like you and bless you as He has promised you!
How can I alone bear the trouble and burden of you and your strife?

verse.text: Choose for yourselves men [i]who are[/i] [xref]a[/xref]wise and prudent and well-attested, according to your tribes, and I will make them your [xref]b[/xref]leaders.

chapter.verse: And you answered me and said, The thing that you have said to do is good.

verse.text: So I took the [xref]a[/xref]leaders of your tribes, men [i]who were wise[/i] and well-attested, and I made them leaders over you, captains over thousands and captains over hundreds and captains over fifties and captains over tens and officials for your tribes.
And I charged your judges at that time, saying, Hear [i]the cases[/i] between your brothers, and [note]1[/note]judge righteously between a man and his brother or the sojourner with him.
verse.note: Or, administer righteousness as judges.

verse.text: You shall [xref]a[/xref]not respect persons in judgment; you shall hear the small and the great alike. You shall not fear the face of man, for judgment is God's. And the case that is too hard for you, you shall [xref]b[/xref]bring to me; and I will hear it.

chapter.verse: And I commanded you at that time all the things that you should do.

verse.text: And we set out from Horeb, and we went through all that great and awesome [xref]a[/xref]wilderness, which you saw, on the way to the hill country of the Amorites, as Jehovah our God commanded us; and we came to [note]1[/note]Kadesh-barnea.
verse.note: For the failure of Israel at Kadesh-barnea, see notes in [link]Num. 13-14[/link].

chapter.verse: And I said to you, You have come to the hill country of the Amorites, which Jehovah our God is giving us.
See, Jehovah your God has set the land before you; go up, possess [i]it,[/i] as Jehovah the God of your fathers has spoken to you. Do not fear, neither be dismayed.

Then all of you came near to me and said, Let us send men before us that they may search out the land for us and bring back to us word concerning the way by which we should go up and the cities into which we should go.

verse.text: And the thing pleased me, so I took [xref]a[/xref]twelve men from among you, one for each tribe.
And they turned and went up into the hill country, and they came to the [xref]a[/xref]Valley of Eshcol; and they spied out [note]1[/note]the land.
verse.note: Lit., it.

chapter.verse: And in their hands they took some of the fruit of the land, and they brought [i]it[/i] down to us. And they brought word back to us and said, It is a good land which Jehovah our God is giving us.
Yet you would not go up. Rather you rebelled against the word of Jehovah your God;

verse.text: And you [xref]a[/xref]murmured in your tents and said, Because Jehovah hates us, He has brought us out from the land of Egypt to deliver us into the hands of the Amorites in order to destroy us.

Where shall we go up? Our brothers have made our hearts melt, saying, [xref]a[/xref]The people are greater and taller than we; the cities are big and fortified up to heaven; and furthermore we have seen the children of the Anakim there.
Then I said to you, [xref]a[/xref]Do not be terrified, neither be afraid of them.
Jehovah your God, who goes before you, He will [xref]a[/xref]fight for you according to all that He did for you in Egypt before your eyes,
And in the wilderness, where you have seen that Jehovah your God [xref]a[/xref]carried you, as a man carries his [xref]b[/xref]son, in all the way that you went until you came to this place.
Yet in spite of this word you did [xref]a[/xref]not believe in Jehovah your God,
Who went before you in the way, to seek out for you a place for you to camp, in the [xref]a[/xref]fire by night to show you by which way you should go and in the cloud by day.

chapter.verse: And Jehovah heard the voice of your words, and He became furious and swore, saying,

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Not one of these men, this evil generation, shall by any means see the good land which I have sworn to give to your fathers,
Except [xref]a[/xref]Caleb the son of Jephunneh; he shall see it. And to him I will give the land on which he has trodden, and to his children, because he has fully followed Jehovah.
With me also Jehovah was angry on your account, saying, You also shall [xref]a[/xref]not enter there;
[xref]a[/xref]Joshua the son of Nun, who attends to you, he shall enter there. Strengthen him, for it is he who will cause Israel to inherit it.

Moreover your [xref]a[/xref]little ones, who you said would be prey, and your children, who this day do not know good and evil, they shall enter there. And to them I will give it, and they will possess it.
But as for you, [xref]a[/xref]turn and set out into the wilderness by the way [i]that leads[/i] to the Red Sea.

[xref]a[/xref]Then you answered and said to me, We have sinned against Jehovah; we ourselves will go up and fight according to all that Jehovah our God has commanded us. And you girded yourselves, every man with his weapons of war, and thought it a light thing to go up to the hill country.

chapter.verse: And Jehovah said to me, Say to them, You shall not go up and fight, for I am not among you, so that you are not struck down before your enemies.
So I spoke to you, but you did not listen; rather, you rebelled against the word of Jehovah and went up presumptuously to the hill country.
And the Amorites who dwell in that hill country came out against you and chased you as bees do; and they beat you back in Seir as far as Hormah.
And you returned and wept before Jehovah; but Jehovah did not listen to your voice nor give ear to you.
So you remained in Kadesh for many days, as many days as you remained.

verse.text: And we [xref]a[/xref]turned and set out for the wilderness by the way [i]that leads[/i] to the Red Sea, as Jehovah spoke to me; and we circled Mount Seir for many days.

chapter.verse: Then Jehovah spoke to me, saying,
You have circled this mountain long enough; turn northward,

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]And command the people, saying, You are about to pass through the territory of your brothers the children of Esau, who dwell in Seir; and they will be afraid of you. Take careful heed to yourselves therefore;

chapter.verse: Do not engage them, for I will not give you any of their land, not even as much as a footstep; for I have given Mount Seir to Esau as a possession.
You shall buy food from them with money, that you may eat; and you shall also obtain water from them with money, that you may drink.

verse.text: For Jehovah your God has [note]1[/note]blessed you in all your doings; He knows your journeying through this great wilderness. These [xref]a[/xref]forty years Jehovah your God has been with you; you have not lacked a thing.
verse.note: In the years of wandering God had mercy on His people and blessed them, even though they were fleshly and full of unbelief. God's mercy extends farther than His grace (see notes [link]13[sup]3[/sup] in 1 Tim. 1[/link], [link]2[sup]1[/sup] in 2 Tim. 1[/link], [link]5[sup]2[/sup] in Titus 3[/link], and [link]16[sup]2[/sup] in Heb. 4[/link]). When God's grace extends so far that it reaches us where we are, it becomes mercy. Since His mercy has reached us and since we are now under His mercy, God can bless us.

chapter.verse: So we passed on from our brothers the children of Esau, who dwell in Seir, away from the way of the Arabah, away from Elath and from Ezion-geber; and we turned and passed on by the way [i]that leads[/i] to the wilderness of Moab.

verse.text: And Jehovah said to me, [xref]a[/xref]Do not harass Moab, nor engage them in battle, for I will not give you any of their land as a possession; for to the children of Lot I have given Ar as a possession.
(The Emim dwelt there before that, a people great and numerous and as tall as the [note]1[/note]Anakim;
verse.note: See [link]Num. 13:33[/link] and note.

verse.text: They were considered [note]1[/note]Rephaim, as were the Anakim, but the Moabites called them Emim.
verse.note: A race of giants ([link]3:11[/link]).

chapter.verse: The Horites also dwelt in Seir before that, but the children of Esau dispossessed them and destroyed them from before them; and they dwelt [i]there[/i] in their place, as Israel did with the land of their possession, which Jehovah gave to them.)
Now rise up and cross over the brook Zered. And we crossed over the brook Zered.

verse.text: And the time that we spent in going from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed over the brook Zered was thirty-eight years, until all the generation of the men of war was [note]1[/note]consumed from the midst of the camp, as Jehovah had [xref]a[/xref]sworn to them.
verse.note: The purpose of the thirty-eight years of wandering was to consume man's flesh and unbelief, to consume all the unbelieving ones, and to manifest God's mercy and blessing ([link]v. 7[/link]). Those years were also used by God to produce a new generation for the fulfilling of God's purpose.

chapter.verse: Moreover the hand of Jehovah was against them to purge them from the midst of the camp until they were consumed.
So when all the men of war were consumed from the midst of the people and dead,
Then Jehovah spoke to me, saying,
You are to pass through the territory of Moab, through Ar, today.

verse.text: And when you come near to the children of Ammon, [xref]a[/xref]do not harass them, nor engage them, for I will not give any of the land of the children of Ammon to you as a possession; for I have given it to the children of Lot as a possession.

chapter.verse: (It was also considered a land of Rephaim; Rephaim formerly dwelt in it. But the Ammonites call them Zamzummim,
A people great and numerous and as tall as the Anakim. Yet Jehovah destroyed them from before them, and they dispossessed them and dwelt [i]there[/i] in their place;
As He did for the children of Esau, who dwell in Seir, when He destroyed the Horites from before them. And they dispossessed them and have dwelt [i]there[/i] in their place to this day.
And the Avvim, who dwell in the villages as far as Gaza, the Caphtorim, who came from Caphtor, destroyed them and dwelt [i]there[/i] in their place.)

verse.text: Rise up; set out and cross over the valley of the [xref]a[/xref]Arnon. See, I have given into your hand Sihon the [note]1[/note]Amorite, the king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin to possess [i]it,[/i] and engage him in battle.
verse.note: See note [link]1[sup]2[/sup] in Num. 21[/link].

chapter.verse: Today I will begin to put the dread and fear of you upon the peoples under all heaven, who will hear the report of you and will tremble and quake because of you.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Then I sent messengers from the wilderness of Kedemoth to Sihon the king of Heshbon with words of peace, saying,

chapter.verse: Let me pass through your land. Only on the road I will go; I will not turn to the right or to the left.
You will sell me food for money, that I may eat; and you will give me water for money, that I may drink; only let me pass through on foot —
As the children of Esau, who dwell in Seir, and the Moabites, who dwell in Ar, did for me — until I cross over the Jordan into the land which Jehovah our God is giving us.

verse.text: But Sihon the king of Heshbon would not let us pass through [note]1[/note]his land, for Jehovah your God [note]2[/note][xref]a[/xref]hardened his spirit and made his heart obstinate for the purpose of delivering him into your hand, as [i]he is[/i] today.
verse.note: Lit., him.
Cf. note [link]12[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 9[/link].

chapter.verse: And Jehovah said to me, See, I have begun to deliver Sihon and his land up before you. Begin to possess [i]it[/i] that you may occupy his land.
Then Sihon came out to meet us, he and all his people, for battle at Jahaz.
And Jehovah our God delivered him up before us, and we slew him and his sons and all his people.

verse.text: And we captured all his cities at that time, and [note]1[/note]utterly destroyed every city — men, women, and children; we left no survivors.
verse.note: Lit., devoted (in this case, unto destruction). So also throughout this book.

chapter.verse: We took only the cattle as our plunder, as well as the spoil of the cities which we captured.

From Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the Arnon, and [i]from[/i] the city which is in the valley, even to Gilead, there was not a town too high for us; Jehovah our God delivered [i]them[/i] all up before us.
But you did not go near the land of the children of Ammon, all along the river Jabbok, nor the cities of the hill country, nor any place that Jehovah our God commanded us [i]not to.[/i]

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Then we turned and went up on the way [i]that leads[/i] to Bashan; and Og the king of Bashan came out to meet us, he and all his people, for battle at Edrei.

But Jehovah said to me, Do not fear him, for I have given him and all his people and his land into your hand; and you shall do to him as you did to [xref]a[/xref]Sihon the king of the Amorites, who was dwelling in Heshbon.
And Jehovah our God also gave [xref]a[/xref]Og the king of Bashan, as well as all his people, into our hand; and we slew them until there was no survivor left to him.

chapter.verse: And we captured all his cities at that time; there was not a town that we did not take from them: sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
All of these were cities fortified with high walls, gates, and bars, besides a great many rural villages.
And we utterly destroyed them as we had done to Sihon the king of Heshbon, utterly destroying every city — men, women, and children.
But all the cattle and the spoil of the cities we took as our plunder.

verse.text: So at that time we [note]1[/note]took the land from the hand of the two kings of the Amorites who were across the Jordan, from the valley of the [xref]a[/xref]Arnon to Mount [xref]b[/xref]Hermon
verse.note: To defeat King Sihon and King Og was to defeat the two "gate guards" of the land of Canaan (see note [link]1[sup]2[/sup] in Num. 21[/link]). This was the initiation of the taking possession of the good land. The land of those two kings was given to the tribes of Reuben and Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh ([link]vv. 12-13[/link]) as the firstfruits of the enjoyment of the God-promised land (see [link]Num. 32[/link]).

verse.text: (The Sidonians call Hermon [xref]a[/xref]Sirion, and the Amorites call it [xref]b[/xref]Senir),
[xref]a[/xref]All the cities of the Plateau and all Gilead and all Bashan, as far as Salcah and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan.

(For only Og the king of Bashan was left of the remnant of the [xref]a[/xref]Rephaim. His bedstead, a bedstead of iron, is indeed now in Rabbah of the children of Ammon. Its length is nine cubits and its width four cubits, according to the cubit of a man.)
So we possessed this land at that time. [xref]a[/xref]From Aroer, which is by the valley of the Arnon, and half the hill country of Gilead and its cities, I gave to the Reubenites and to the Gadites.

chapter.verse: And the rest of Gilead and all Bashan, the kingdom of Og, I gave to the half-tribe of Manasseh, all the region of Argob. (All that [i]portion of[/i] Bashan is called the land of the Rephaim.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Jair the son of Manasseh took all the region of Argob as far as the border of the Geshurites and the Maacathites; and he called [note]1[/note]it, [i]that is,[/i] Bashan, after his own name, [note]2[/note]Havvoth-jair, [i]as it is[/i] to this day.)
verse.note: Lit., them; referring to the cities of the region of Argob (cf. [link]v. 4[/link]; [link]Num. 32:41[/link]).
Meaning [i]the villages of Jair.[/i]

chapter.verse: And to Machir I gave Gilead.

And to the Reubenites and to the Gadites I gave [i]the region[/i] from Gilead even as far as the valley of the Arnon, the middle of the valley being the border, as far as the river Jabbok, the border of the children of Ammon;

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]And the Arabah, with the Jordan as a border, from [note]1[/note]Chinnereth even as far as the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah on the east.
verse.note: Called Gennesaret and the Sea of Galilee in the New Testament ([link]Luke 5:1[/link] and note).

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]And I charged you at that time, saying, Jehovah your God has given you this land that you may possess it; all the men of valor shall cross over armed before your brothers, the children of Israel.

chapter.verse: Only your wives and your little ones and your livestock — I know that you have vast livestock — shall remain in your cities, which I have given you,

verse.text: Until Jehovah gives [xref]a[/xref]rest to your brothers as [i]He has[/i] to you, and they also possess the land which Jehovah your God is giving them across the Jordan, and you return, each man to his possession which I have given you.

chapter.verse: And I commanded Joshua at that time, saying, Yours are the eyes that have seen all that Jehovah your God has done to these two kings; so will Jehovah do to all the kingdoms into which you are about to cross over.

verse.text: Do not fear them, for it is Jehovah your God who is [xref]a[/xref]fighting for you.

chapter.verse: And I pleaded with Jehovah at that time, saying,

O Lord Jehovah, You have begun to show Your servant Your greatness and Your mighty hand. For what god is there in heaven or on earth who can do things like what You have done and things like Your mighty deeds?
Let me please cross over and see the good land that is across the Jordan, this fine hill country and Lebanon.

verse.text: But Jehovah was infuriated with me on your account and did not listen to me. And Jehovah said to me, [note]1[/note]Enough! Speak no more to Me about this matter.
verse.note: Lit., Enough for you. Moses served God faithfully for forty years, but because his mistake in [link]Num. 20[/link] (see note [link book="Num." chapter="20"]12[sup]1[/sup][/link] there) involved God's governmental administration, he lost the right to enter into the good land. God's dealing with Moses helped to perfect the children of Israel, causing them to have more fear of God's righteous dealing. This is God's perfecting love for His people (cf. [link]Heb. 12:5-11[/link]).

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Go up to the top of Pisgah; and lift up your eyes to the [note]1[/note]west and to the north and to the south and to the east; and see [i]it[/i] with your eyes, for you shall not cross over this Jordan.
verse.note: I.e., the Mediterranean Sea.

verse.text: But charge [xref]a[/xref]Joshua, and strengthen and encourage him, for it is he who will cross over before this people and cause them to inherit the land which you will see.

chapter.verse: And we remained in the valley opposite Beth-peor.

verse.text: And now, O Israel, listen to the [note]1[/note]statutes and the [note]1[/note]ordinances which I am teaching you to do, in order that you may [xref]a[/xref]live and go in and possess the land which Jehovah, the God of your fathers, is giving you.
verse.note: The Ten Commandments are the basic law ([link]5:6-21[/link]). The statutes give supplemental details of the law. When a judgment is added to a statute, the statute becomes an ordinance.

verse.text: You shall [xref]a[/xref]not add to the word which I am commanding you, nor shall you [xref]b[/xref]take away from it, that you may keep the commandments of Jehovah your God, which I am commanding you.
Yours are the eyes that have seen that which Jehovah has done in [xref]a[/xref]Baal-peor; for all the men who went after Baal-peor, Jehovah your God has destroyed from your midst.
But you who [xref]a[/xref]joined yourselves to Jehovah your God are alive, all of you, today.

chapter.verse: See, I have taught you statutes and ordinances, as Jehovah my God commanded me, so that you would do them within the land which you are going in to possess.
Keep and do [i]them[/i] therefore; for this will be your wisdom and prudence in the sight of the peoples who hear all these statutes and say, Surely this great nation is a wise and prudent people.

verse.text: For what great [xref]a[/xref]nation is there that has a god so [xref]b[/xref]near to it as Jehovah our God is whenever we [note]1[/note][xref]c[/xref]call upon Him?
verse.note: See note [link]21[sup]1[/sup] in Acts 2[/link].

chapter.verse: And what great nation is there that has statutes and ordinances so righteous as all this law which I am setting before you today?

But be careful and guard your soul diligently, so that you do not forget the things which your eyes have seen and they do not depart from your heart all the days of your life; rather, make them known to your children and to your grandchildren.

[i]Especially do not forget[/i] the day when you stood before Jehovah your God at Horeb, when Jehovah said to me, Gather the people to Me, and I will let them hear My words, so that they may learn to fear Me all the days that they live upon the earth and may teach their children [i]as much.[/i]

verse.text: And you came near and [xref]a[/xref]stood at the foot of the mountain; and the mountain was burning with [xref]b[/xref]fire up into the heart of heaven, with darkness, cloud, and deep darkness [i]there.[/i]
And Jehovah spoke to you from the midst of the fire. The [xref]a[/xref]sound of words could you hear, but no [xref]b[/xref]form could you see; [i]there was[/i] only a voice.
And He declared to you His covenant, which He commanded you to do, [xref]a[/xref]ten [note]1[/note]commandments; and He wrote them upon two [xref]b[/xref]tablets of stone.
verse.note: Lit., words. See note [link]1[sup]1[/sup], par. 1, in Exo. 20[/link].

chapter.verse: And Jehovah commanded me at that time to teach you statutes and ordinances for you to do in the land which you are about to cross over into to possess.
So take careful heed to your souls, for you did not see any form at all on the day when Jehovah spoke to you at Horeb from the midst of the fire,

verse.text: So that you do not spoil yourselves and make for yourselves an [xref]a[/xref]idol, a form of any image, a figure of male or female,

chapter.verse: A figure of any animal which is on the earth, a figure of any winged bird which flies in the sky,
A figure of anything that crawls on the ground, a figure of any fish that is in the water under the earth;

verse.text: And [i]take heed[/i] that, when you lift up your eyes to the sky and see the [xref]a[/xref]sun and the moon and the stars, all the [xref]b[/xref]host of heaven, you are not drawn away in worship to them and that you do not serve them, which Jehovah your God has assigned to all the peoples under all heaven.
But Jehovah has taken you and brought you forth from the [xref]a[/xref]iron furnace, from Egypt, that you would be to Him a people for [i]His[/i] inheritance, as [i]you are[/i] this day.

But Jehovah was [xref]a[/xref]angry with me on your account and swore that I would [xref]b[/xref]not cross over the Jordan and that I would not enter the good land which Jehovah your God is giving you as an inheritance.
For I am to die in this land; I am [xref]a[/xref]not to cross over the Jordan. But you are crossing over and you will possess this good land.

chapter.verse: Take heed to yourselves that you do not forget the covenant of Jehovah your God, which He has made with you, and make for yourselves an idol, the form of anything, which Jehovah your God has forbidden you [i]to make.[/i]

verse.text: For Jehovah your God is a [xref]a[/xref]consuming fire, a [xref]b[/xref]jealous God.

When you have brought forth children and grandchildren and have [note]1[/note]languished in the land, and you have spoiled yourselves by making an idol, the form of anything, and have done that which is evil in the sight of Jehovah your God so as to anger Him;
verse.note: "The word (which is a rare one) implies 'the loss of spiritual freshness, and the blunting of original impressions, produced by force of custom, or long residence in the same spot' (Dillman)." (S. R. Driver)

verse.text: I call [xref]a[/xref]heaven and earth to witness against you today that surely you will soon perish from off the land into which you are crossing over the Jordan to possess; you will not extend your days upon it, but you will be utterly destroyed.
And Jehovah will [xref]a[/xref]scatter you among the peoples, and you will be left [xref]b[/xref]few in number among the nations to which Jehovah will drive you.
And there you will serve gods [i]which are[/i] the work of human [xref]a[/xref]hands, [i]mere[/i] wood and stone, which do not see nor hear nor eat nor smell.
And from there you will [xref]a[/xref]seek Jehovah your God, and you will find [i]Him[/i] if you search for Him with [xref]b[/xref]all your heart and with all your soul.

chapter.verse: When you are in distress and all these things happen to you, [i]when you are[/i] in the last days, you will return to Jehovah your God and listen to His voice.

verse.text: For Jehovah your God is a [xref]a[/xref]compassionate God; He will [xref]b[/xref]not fail you nor let you perish nor forget the covenant with your fathers which He swore to them.

chapter.verse: For ask now regarding the former days, which were before you, since the day that God created man upon the earth, and [i]ask[/i] from one end of heaven to the other, Has anything as great as this ever happened, or has anything like this ever been heard of?

verse.text: Has a people ever heard the voice of God speaking from the midst of the [xref]a[/xref]fire, as you have heard, and lived?

Has God ever ventured to go and take to Himself a nation from the midst of [i]another[/i] nation by trials, by signs and wonders, and by war and a [xref]a[/xref]mighty hand and an outstretched arm, and by great terrors, like all that Jehovah your God did for you in Egypt before your eyes?
You were shown [i]these things[/i] that you might know that it is Jehovah who is God; there is [xref]a[/xref]no other besides Him.

chapter.verse: From heaven He let you hear His voice that He might discipline you, and upon the earth He showed you His great fire, and His words you heard from the midst of the fire.

verse.text: And because He [xref]a[/xref]loved your fathers, He chose their seed after them and brought you out by His presence, by His great power, from Egypt,
[xref]a[/xref]Driving out from before you nations greater and mightier than you, to bring you in [i]and[/i] give you their land as an inheritance, as [i]it is[/i] today.
Know therefore today and bring [i]it[/i] to heart that Jehovah is God in [xref]a[/xref]heaven above and upon the earth below; there is no other.

Therefore keep His statutes and His commandments, which I am commanding you today, that it may go well with you and with your children after you, so that you may extend your days upon the land which Jehovah your God is giving you [note]1[/note]forever.
verse.note: Lit., all the days.

verse.text: Then Moses set apart three [note]1[/note]cities across the Jordan toward the rising of the sun,
verse.note: For the cities of refuge, see notes in [link]Num. 35:9-34[/link].

verse.text: That the [xref]a[/xref]manslayer might flee there, who slays his neighbor without intent and did not hate him previously, and in fleeing to one of these cities he might live:

chapter.verse: Bezer in the wilderness, in the land of the Plateau, belonging to the Reubenites; and Ramoth in Gilead, belonging to the Gadites; and Golan in Bashan, belonging to the Manassites.
And this is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel;
These are the testimonies and the statutes and the ordinances which Moses spoke to the children of Israel when they had gone out from Egypt,

verse.text: Across the Jordan, in the valley opposite Beth-peor, in the land of [xref]a[/xref]Sihon the king of the Amorites, who dwelt in Heshbon, whom Moses and the children of Israel slew when they had gone out from Egypt.
And they possessed his land and the land of [xref]a[/xref]Og the king of Bashan, the two kings of the Amorites, who were across the Jordan toward the rising of the sun,
From Aroer, which is on the edge of the valley of the [xref]a[/xref]Arnon, even unto Mount [note]1[/note]Sirion, that is, Hermon,
verse.note: Following an ancient version; the Hebrew text reads, Sion (cf. [link]3:9[/link]).

verse.text: And all the Arabah across the Jordan on the east even to the [note]1[/note]sea of the Arabah at the foot of the slopes of Pisgah.
verse.note: I.e., the Dead Sea.

chapter.verse: And Moses called all Israel and said to them, Hear, O Israel, the statutes and the ordinances which I am speaking in your hearing today, and learn them and keep them, so that you may do them.

verse.text: Jehovah our God made a [xref]a[/xref]covenant with us at Horeb.
Not with our fathers did Jehovah make this covenant, but with [note]1[/note]us, we who are all here alive today.
verse.note: In the sight of God, the covenant made at Horeb ([link]Exo. 24:1-8[/link]) was actually made with the present new generation of Israel. This is according to the biblical principle that the children are included in the father ([link]Heb. 7:9-10[/link]).

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Face to face Jehovah spoke with you on the mountain from the midst of the fire —

[xref]a[/xref]I was standing between Jehovah and you at that time to declare to you the word of Jehovah, for you were [xref]b[/xref]afraid because of the fire and did not go up to the mountain — saying,
[note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]I am Jehovah your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the slave house;
verse.note: For [link]vv. 6-21[/link], see notes in [link]Exo. 20:1-17[/link].

verse.text: You shall have no other gods [note]1[/note]before Me.
verse.note: Or, besides; in addition to.

chapter.verse: You shall not make for yourself an idol, the form of anything that is in heaven above or on the earth beneath or in the water beneath the earth.

You shall not bow down to them, and you shall not serve them; for I, Jehovah your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers upon the children and to the third and fourth [i]generations[/i] of those who hate Me,

verse.text: Yet showing [xref]a[/xref]lovingkindness to thousands [i]of generations[/i] of those who love Me and keep My commandments.

chapter.verse: You shall not take the name of Jehovah your God in vain, for Jehovah will not hold guiltless him who takes His name in vain.
Keep the Sabbath day so as to sanctify it, as Jehovah your God has commanded you.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Six days you shall labor and do all your work,

But the [xref]a[/xref]seventh day is a Sabbath to Jehovah your God; you shall not do any work, you nor your son nor your daughter nor your male servant nor your female servant nor your ox nor your donkey nor any of your cattle nor the sojourner with you who is within your gates, so that your male servant and your female servant may rest as you do.

And you shall [xref]a[/xref]remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and [i]that[/i] Jehovah your God brought you out from there with a [xref]b[/xref]mighty hand and an outstretched arm; hence, Jehovah your God commanded you to hold the Sabbath day.

Honor your father and your mother, as Jehovah your God has commanded you, that your days may be [note]1[/note]extended and that it may be [note]1[/note]well with you upon the land which Jehovah your God is giving you.
verse.note: Having our days extended is a matter of longevity, and having things go well with us is a matter of being blessed. The commandment to honor our parents is the first commandment with a promise ([link]Eph. 6:2[/link]).

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]You shall [xref]b[/xref]not kill;
[xref]a[/xref]Neither shall you commit adultery;
[xref]a[/xref]Neither shall you steal;

chapter.verse: Neither shall you testify as a vain witness against your neighbor;

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Neither shall you covet your neighbor's wife, nor shall you desire your neighbor's house, his field, or his male servant or his female servant, his ox or his donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.

These words Jehovah spoke to all your congregation on the mountain from the midst of the [xref]a[/xref]fire, the cloud, and the deep darkness, with a great voice; and He added no more. And He wrote them upon two [xref]b[/xref]tablets of stone and gave them to me.
And when you heard the voice from the midst of the [xref]a[/xref]darkness, while the mountain burned with fire, you came near to me, all the heads of your tribes and your elders,

And said, Jehovah our God has just shown us His glory and His greatness, and His [xref]a[/xref]voice we have heard from the midst of the fire; today we have seen that God speaks with man and yet he lives.

chapter.verse: Therefore why should we die now? For this great fire will consume us. If we hear the voice of Jehovah our God any longer, we will die.

verse.text: For who is there among all flesh who has heard the voice of the [xref]a[/xref]living God speaking from the midst of the fire, as we have, and has lived?

chapter.verse: You go near and hear all that Jehovah our God says; then you will speak to us all that Jehovah our God speaks to you, and we will hear and do.

And Jehovah heard the sound of your words while you spoke to me; and Jehovah said to me, I have heard the sound of the words of this people which they have spoken to you; they have done well in all that they have spoken.
Oh that this heart of theirs would be in them always to fear Me and keep all My commandments so that it may go well with them and with their children forever!
Go, say to them, Return to your tents.
But you, stand here by Me that I may speak to you the whole commandment, and the statutes and the ordinances, which you will teach them to do in the land which I am giving them to possess.
Keep them therefore so that you may do [i]them,[/i] even as Jehovah your God has commanded you; you shall not turn aside to the right or to the left.

verse.text: You shall walk in all the way that Jehovah your God has commanded you, so that you may [xref]a[/xref]live and that it may go well with you and that you may extend your days in the land which you will possess.

Now this is the [note]1[/note]commandment, the statutes and the ordinances, which Jehovah your God has commanded [i]me[/i] to teach you, that you may do [i]them[/i] in the land into which you are crossing over to possess;
verse.note: See note [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 4[/link]. In Deuteronomy the law, the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances are all God's word ([link]Psa. 119[/link]), and the totality, the aggregate, of God's word is Christ ([link]John 1:1[/link], [link]14[/link]). Whereas the children of Israel were charged to keep the commandments, statutes, and ordinances, we today need to keep Christ. By taking Christ, keeping Christ, and holding fast to Him, we will gain Him, enjoy Him, and live Him ([link]Phil. 3:8[/link]; [link]1:19-21a[/link]). See notes [link]3[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link] and [link]12[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 30[/link].

chapter.verse: That you may fear Jehovah your God and keep all His statutes and His commandments, which I am commanding you, you and your son and your grandson, all the days of your life; and that your days may be extended.

verse.text: Therefore hear, O Israel, and be certain to do [i]it,[/i] that it may go well with you and that you may be greatly increased, [i]in[/i] a land flowing with [xref]a[/xref]milk and honey, even as Jehovah, the God of your fathers, promised you.
[xref]a[/xref]Hear, O Israel, [note]1[/note]Jehovah is our God; Jehovah is [xref]b[/xref]one.
verse.note: Or, Jehovah our God is one Jehovah.

verse.text: And you shall [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]love Jehovah your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might.
verse.note: See notes [link book="Deut." chapter="10"]12[sup]2[/sup][/link] and [link]12[sup]3[/sup] in ch. 10[/link]. The admonitions in [link]vv. 5-9[/link] can all be applied to Christ (see note [link]1[sup]1[/sup][/link]). We need to love Christ, keep Christ, teach Christ, wear Christ, and write Christ.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]And these words, which I command you today, shall be upon your [xref]b[/xref]heart;
And you shall [note]1[/note]repeat them to your children, and speak about them when you sit in your house and when you journey on the way, and when you lie down and when you rise up;
verse.note: Or, teach them diligently to your children.

verse.text: And you shall bind them on your hand as a [xref]a[/xref]sign, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes;
And you shall write them on the [xref]a[/xref]doorposts of your house and on your gates.
And when Jehovah your God brings you into the land which He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to [xref]a[/xref]give you great and fine cities that you did not build,

And [xref]a[/xref]houses full of every good thing that you did not fill, and hewn cisterns that you did not hew, vineyards and olive groves that you did not plant, and you have eaten and are satisfied;
Be careful that you do not [xref]a[/xref]forget Jehovah who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the slave house.
[xref]a[/xref]It is Jehovah your God whom you shall fear, and Him whom you shall [xref]b[/xref]serve; and it is by His name [i]only[/i] that you shall swear.

chapter.verse: You shall not go after other gods, any of the gods of the peoples who surround you —

verse.text: For Jehovah your God is a [xref]a[/xref]jealous God in the midst of you. Otherwise the anger of Jehovah your God will be kindled against you, and He will destroy you from off the face of the earth.
You shall not [xref]a[/xref]test Jehovah your God, as you tested [i]Him[/i] at [note]1[/note]Massah.
verse.note: See [link]Exo. 17:1-7[/link] and note [link]7[sup]1[/sup][/link].
verse.xref: Matt. 4:7; Luke 4:12; cf. Exo. 17:2; 1 Cor. 10:9; Heb. 3:9

chapter.verse: You shall diligently keep the commandments of Jehovah your God and His testimonies and His statutes, which He has commanded you.
And you shall do that which is right and good in the sight of Jehovah so that it may go well with you and you may enter and possess the good land, concerning which Jehovah swore to your fathers
To drive out all your enemies from before you, as Jehovah has spoken.

verse.text: When your son asks you [note]1[/note]in the future, saying, What is [i]the significance of[/i] the testimonies and the statutes and the ordinances that Jehovah our God commanded you?
verse.note: Lit., tomorrow.

verse.text: Then you will [xref]a[/xref]say to your son, We were Pharaoh's slaves in Egypt, and Jehovah brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand.

chapter.verse: And Jehovah put forth before our eyes great and grievous signs and wonders in Egypt against Pharaoh and all his house.
Then He brought us out from there in order to bring us in, that He might give us the land which He swore to our fathers.
And Jehovah commanded us to do all these statutes so that we would fear Jehovah our God for our good always [i]and[/i] He would preserve us alive, as [i]we are[/i] this day.
And it will be righteousness to us if we are certain to do all this commandment before Jehovah our God, as He commanded us.

verse.text: When Jehovah your God brings you into the land which you are about to enter to possess, and clears away many [note]1[/note]nations from before you — the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, the Jebusites, [xref]a[/xref]seven nations more numerous and mightier than you —
verse.note: See note [link]23[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 23[/link].

verse.text: And Jehovah your God delivers them up before you and you defeat them, you shall [note]1[/note]utterly destroy them; you shall make no covenant with them, nor shall you show them any favor.
verse.note: According to the divine thought, the nations in the land of Canaan had to be exterminated because they were devilish and mingled with demons ([link]9:4-5[/link]; [link]18:9-14[/link]; cf. [link]1 Cor. 10:20-21[/link]). See note [link]33[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 13[/link].

verse.text: And you shall not make marriage [xref]a[/xref]alliances with them: [xref]b[/xref]Your daughters you shall not give to their sons, and their daughters you shall not take for your sons;

chapter.verse: For they will draw your sons away from [i]following[/i] after Me to serve other gods, and the anger of Jehovah will burn against you and He will quickly destroy you.

verse.text: But you shall deal with them in this way: Their [xref]a[/xref]altars you shall tear down, their pillars you shall shatter, their [note]1[/note]Asherahs you shall hew down, and their idols you shall burn with fire.
verse.note: Images of a female deity.

verse.text: For you are a [xref]a[/xref]holy people to Jehovah your God; it is you whom Jehovah your God has [xref]b[/xref]chosen from among all the peoples which are upon the face of the earth to be a people for His [note]1[/note][xref]c[/xref]personal treasure.
verse.note: See note [link]5[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 19[/link].

verse.text: It was not because you were more numerous than all the peoples that Jehovah has set His [xref]a[/xref]affection on you and has chosen you, for you were the fewest of all the peoples;

Rather, because Jehovah loved you and because He would keep the oath which He [xref]a[/xref]swore to your fathers, Jehovah has brought you out with a mighty hand and ransomed you from the slave house, from the hand of Pharaoh, the king of Egypt.

Know therefore that it is Jehovah your God who is God, the [xref]a[/xref]faithful God who [xref]b[/xref]keeps covenant and [xref]c[/xref]lovingkindness to the thousandth generation with those who love Him and keep His commandments,

chapter.verse: But repays directly those who hate Him by destroying them. He will not be slow toward him who hates Him; He will repay him directly.
Therefore you shall keep the commandment, and the statutes and the ordinances, which I am commanding you today to do.
And it will be that because you listen to these ordinances, and keep them and do them, Jehovah your God will keep with you the covenant and the lovingkindness which He swore to your fathers.

verse.text: And He will love you and [note]1[/note]bless you and multiply you; He will also [xref]a[/xref]bless the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your ground, your grain and your new wine and your fresh oil, the offspring of your cattle and the young of your flock, on the land which He swore to your fathers to give you.
verse.note: It is in Christ that we receive and enjoy God's blessings ([link]Eph. 1:3[/link]). The unique commandment God gives to the world is to believe in His Son and receive Him (see note [link]5[sup]3[/sup] in Rom. 1[/link]). Actually, Christ Himself is the commandment of God. We need to receive Him, keep Him, and be right with Him. If we do this, we will be right with God, and He will love us and bless us ([link]John 14:21[/link], [link]23[/link]).

verse.text: You will be more blessed than all [i]other[/i] peoples; there will not be any [xref]a[/xref]barren male or female among you or among your animals.
And Jehovah will remove every [xref]a[/xref]sickness from you, and none of the evil illnesses of Egypt, which you know about, will He put upon you; but He will give them to all who hate you.
And you shall devour all the peoples which Jehovah your God is giving you; your eye shall not pity them, nor shall you serve their gods, for that would be a [xref]a[/xref]snare to you.

chapter.verse: If you say in your heart, These nations are greater than I, how will I be able to dispossess them?
You shall not be afraid of them; you must remember what Jehovah your God did to Pharaoh and to all Egypt,

The great trials that your eyes saw, and the signs and the wonders, and the mighty hand and the outstretched arm with which Jehovah your God brought you out; so will Jehovah your God do to all the peoples whom you are afraid of.

verse.text: Furthermore, Jehovah your God will send the [xref]a[/xref]hornet among them until those who are left and those who hide themselves from you are destroyed.
You shall not be terrified of them, for Jehovah your God is in your [xref]a[/xref]midst, a great and awesome God.

And Jehovah your God will clear away these nations from before you [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]little by little; you shall not devour all of them immediately, lest the beasts of the field multiply against you.
verse.note: See note [link]29[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 23[/link].

chapter.verse: But Jehovah your God will deliver them up before you and rout them utterly until they are destroyed.

verse.text: And He will deliver their kings into your hand, and you shall destroy their name from under heaven; no man will be able to [xref]a[/xref]stand against you until you destroy them.

The idols of their gods you shall burn with fire; you shall not desire the silver or gold upon them, nor take it for yourself, lest you be ensnared by it; for it is an [xref]a[/xref]abomination to Jehovah your God.

chapter.verse: And you shall not bring an abomination into your house, lest you become a cursed thing like it; you shall utterly detest it and utterly abhor it, for it is a cursed thing.

verse.text: The whole commandment which I am commanding you today, you shall keep and do, so that you may [xref]a[/xref]live and multiply, and enter and possess the land which Jehovah swore to your fathers.

And you shall remember all the way that Jehovah your God has led you these [xref]a[/xref]forty years in the wilderness in order to humble you and [xref]b[/xref]test you to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep His commandments or not.

And He humbled you and let you go hungry and fed you the [xref]a[/xref]manna, which you had [i]never[/i] known nor your fathers had [i]ever[/i] known, so that He might make you know that [xref]b[/xref]man lives not by bread alone, but that man lives by [note]1[/note]everything that proceeds out from the mouth of Jehovah.
verse.note: In [link]Matt. 4:4[/link] [i]everything[/i] is replaced by [i]every word,[/i] referring to the law, the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances as the words that proceed out of the mouth of God. All the words in this book are God's breathing ([link]2 Tim. 3:16[/link]), and all refer to Christ, who is the totality of God's word ([link]John 1:1[/link]; [link]Rev. 19:13[/link]) to be the life and life supply of God's people. Therefore, to live by every word that proceeds out through the mouth of God is to live by Christ, the embodiment of the divine breath ([link]John 6:57[/link], [link]63[/link]). God was leading His people into the good land, a type of Christ, by Christ, and He was sustaining them on their way to the good land also by Christ, who is everything that proceeds out through the mouth of God. See notes [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 6[/link] and [link]12[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 30[/link].[br][br]God wants us to fulfill His righteous requirements for the accomplishing of His divine economy; however, He does not want us to do this in ourselves. Rather, He wants us to live, work, and have our being in Christ, by Christ, with Christ, through Christ, and in oneness with Christ ([link]Gal. 2:20[/link]). God's desire is that we put ourselves aside, forget ourselves, and fulfill His economy by the Spirit, i.e., by the realization of the Son, who is the embodiment of the Father ([link]John 14:17-18[/link], [link]10[/link]). The Scriptures as the breathing, the exhaling, of God are the embodiment of Christ as the life-giving Spirit ([link]John 6:63[/link]; [link]Eph. 6:17[/link]). By inhaling the word of the Scriptures, we receive the Spirit ([link]Eph. 6:17-18a[/link]; [link]Gal. 3:5[/link]) and enjoy the riches of Christ and thus are enabled to fulfill God's requirements.

verse.text: Your [xref]a[/xref]clothing did not wear out from upon you, nor did your foot swell these forty years.
Know then in your heart that as a man [xref]a[/xref]disciplines his son, so Jehovah your God was disciplining you;

chapter.verse: Therefore keep the commandments of Jehovah your God, walking in His ways and fearing Him.

verse.text: For Jehovah your God is bringing you to a [note]1[/note]good land, a [xref]a[/xref]land of waterbrooks, of springs and of [note]2[/note]fountains, flowing forth in valleys and in mountains;
verse.note: The good land, the land of Canaan, is a full, complete, and consummate type of the all-inclusive Christ, who is the embodiment of the Triune God ([link]Col. 2:9[/link]) realized as the all-inclusive life-giving Spirit ([link]1 Cor. 15:45[/link]; [link]2 Cor. 3:17[/link]), as the inheritance allotted to God's people for their enjoyment ([link]Col. 1:12[/link] and note 2; [link]2:6-7[/link] and note [link]6[sup]2[/sup][/link]; [link]Gal. 3:14[/link] and note 3). The riches of the good land in [link]vv. 7-9[/link] typify the unsearchable riches of Christ in different aspects ([link]Eph. 3:8[/link]) as the bountiful supply to His believers in His Spirit ([link]Phil. 1:19[/link]). The waterbrooks, springs, and fountains signify Christ as the flowing Spirit ([link]John 4:14[/link]; [link]7:37-39[/link]; [link]Rev. 22:1[/link]), and the valleys and mountains signify the different kinds of environments in which we may experience Christ as the flowing Spirit (cf. [link]2 Cor. 6:8-10[/link]). Wheat typifies the incarnated Christ, who was crucified and buried to multiply Himself ([link]John 12:24[/link]), and barley, being the first-ripe grain ([link]2 Sam. 21:9[/link]), points to the resurrected Christ as the firstfruits ([link]1 Cor. 15:20[/link]). Vines typify the Christ who sacrificed Himself to produce wine to cheer God and man ([link]Judg. 9:13[/link]; [link]Matt. 9:17[/link]). The fig tree speaks of the sweetness and satisfaction of Christ as the life supply ([link]Judg. 9:11[/link]); the pomegranates signify the fullness, the abundance and beauty, and the expression of the riches of Christ as life ([link]Exo. 28:33-34[/link]; [link]1 Kings 7:18-20[/link]; [link]S.S. 4:3b[/link], [link]13[/link]); the bread signifies Christ as the bread of life ([link]John 6:35[/link], [link]48[/link]); the olive tree typifies Christ ([link]Rom. 11:17[/link]) as the One who was filled with the Spirit and anointed with the Spirit ([link]Luke 4:1[/link], [link]18[/link]; [link]Heb. 1:9[/link]); olive oil typifies the Holy Spirit, by whom we walk to honor God and whom we minister to honor man ([link]Gal. 5:16[/link], [link]25[/link]; [link]2 Cor. 3:6[/link], [link]8[/link]; [link]Judg. 9:9[/link]); and milk and honey ([link]6:3[/link]) speak forth the goodness and sweetness of Christ (see note [link]8[sup]2[/sup] in Exo. 3[/link]). Stones signify Christ as material for building God's dwelling place ([link]Isa. 28:16[/link]; [link]Zech. 4:7[/link]; [link]1 Pet. 2:4[/link]). The iron and copper are for making weapons ([link]Gen. 4:22[/link]; [link]1 Sam. 17:5-7[/link]) and typify our spiritual warfare by which we fight the enemy ([link]2 Cor. 10:4[/link]; [link]Eph. 6:10-20[/link]). Iron also signifies Christ's ruling authority ([link]Matt. 28:18[/link]; [link]Rev. 19:15[/link]), and copper, Christ's judging power ([link]Rev. 1:15[/link] and note 1). The mountains from which copper is mined signify Christ's resurrection and ascension ([link]Eph. 4:8[/link] and note 1).[br][br]God's goal in His economy is not merely to redeem His people and save them from the world, typified by Egypt, but to bring them into Christ, typified by the good land, that they may possess Him and enjoy His unsearchable riches. By enjoying the riches of the land, the children of Israel were able to build up the temple to be God's habitation on earth and the city of Jerusalem to establish God's kingdom on earth. Likewise, by enjoying the unsearchable riches of Christ, the believers in Christ are built up to be Christ's Body, the church, which is Christ's fullness, His expression ([link]Eph. 1:22-23[/link]), and which is also the habitation of God ([link]Eph. 2:21-22[/link]; [link]1 Tim. 3:15[/link]) and the kingdom of God ([link]Matt. 16:18-19[/link]; [link]Rom. 14:17[/link]). Ultimately, God's habitation and God's kingdom will consummate in the New Jerusalem in eternity for the fulfillment of God's eternal economy ([link]Rev. 21:1-3[/link], [link]22[/link]; [link]22:1[/link], [link]3[/link]).
Or, [i]deep waters.[/i] Concerning the water in the good land, the fountains are the source, and the springs and waterbrooks are the outflow. See note [link]3[sup]2[/sup], par. 1, in Isa. 12[/link].

verse.text: A [xref]a[/xref]land of [xref]b[/xref]wheat and barley and [xref]c[/xref]vines and [xref]d[/xref]fig trees and [xref]e[/xref]pomegranates; a land of [xref]f[/xref]olive trees with oil and of [xref]g[/xref]honey;
verse.xref: 1 Kings 4:25; Micah 4:4; Zech. 3:10; Hag. 2:19; S.S. 6:11; cf. Judg. 9:8-13

chapter.verse: A land in which you will eat bread without scarcity; you will not lack anything in it; a land whose stones are iron, and from whose mountains you can mine copper.
And you shall eat and be satisfied, and you shall bless Jehovah your God for the good land which He has given you.

verse.text: Be [note]1[/note]careful lest you forget Jehovah your God by not keeping His commandments and His ordinances and His statutes, which I am commanding you today;
verse.note: Today we should be careful lest we forget God by not keeping His Christ (cf. [link]Gal. 5:2[/link], [link]4[/link]).

verse.text: Lest when you have eaten and are [xref]a[/xref]satisfied, and have built fine houses and dwell [i]in them,[/i]

chapter.verse: And your herd and your flock have multiplied, and your silver and your gold have multiplied, and all that you have has multiplied,
Your heart be lifted up and you forget Jehovah your God, Him who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the slave house;

verse.text: Who led you through the great and awesome [xref]a[/xref]wilderness, [i]with its[/i] [xref]b[/xref]fiery serpents and scorpions and thirsty ground where there was no water; who brought forth water for you out of flint [xref]c[/xref]rock;
Who fed you [xref]a[/xref]manna in the wilderness, which your fathers had [i]never[/i] known, that He might humble you and that He might test you in order to do good for you in the end;

chapter.verse: And you say in your heart, My strength and the might of my hand have gotten me this wealth.

verse.text: But you shall remember Jehovah your God, for it is He who gives you strength to gain wealth, so that He may establish His [xref]a[/xref]covenant, which He swore to your fathers, as [i]it is[/i] this day.
And if you forget Jehovah your God at all and go after other gods and serve them and bow down to them, [xref]a[/xref]I testify against you [xref]b[/xref]today that you will surely perish.

chapter.verse: Like the nations which Jehovah is about to destroy before your face, so you will perish, because you would not listen to the voice of Jehovah your God.

verse.text: Hear, O Israel! You are about to cross over the Jordan this day in order to enter in and dispossess nations greater and mightier than you, [xref]a[/xref]cities [i]that are[/i] big and fortified up to heaven,
A people great and tall, the children of the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Anakim, whom you know about and [i]of whom[/i] you have heard [i]it said,[/i] Who can stand before the children of Anak?
verse.note: See [link]Num. 13:33[/link] and note.

verse.text: Know therefore today that Jehovah your God is the One crossing over before you as a consuming [xref]a[/xref]fire; it is He who will destroy them, and it is He who will subdue them before you, so that you may dispossess them and destroy them quickly, as Jehovah has said to you.

chapter.verse: Do not say in your heart when Jehovah your God drives them out from before you, Because of my righteousness, Jehovah has brought me in to possess this land. Rather, it is because of the wickedness of these nations that Jehovah is about to dispossess them from before you.

verse.text: It is not because of your [xref]a[/xref]righteousness nor because of the uprightness of your heart that you are entering in to possess their land, but Jehovah your God is about to dispossess them from before you because of the wickedness of these nations and so that Jehovah may establish the word that He swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
Know therefore that it is not because of your righteousness that Jehovah your God is giving you this good land to possess, for you are a [xref]a[/xref]stiff-necked people.

Remember; do not forget that [note]1[/note]you made Jehovah your God [xref]a[/xref]furious in the wilderness; from the day that you came forth from the land of Egypt until you came to this place, you have been rebellious against Jehovah.
verse.note: Because the new generation of Israelites were sons of rebels, they too were rebels in the eyes of God. Cf. note [link]3[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 5[/link].

verse.text: And [i]especially[/i] at [xref]a[/xref]Horeb you made Jehovah [xref]b[/xref]furious, and Jehovah was angry [i]enough[/i] with you to destroy you.

When I went up to the [xref]a[/xref]mountain to receive the tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant which Jehovah made with you, I remained on the mountain [xref]b[/xref]forty days and forty nights; I did not eat food nor drink water.

And Jehovah gave me the two [xref]a[/xref]tablets of stone, written with the finger of God; and on them [i]was what was[/i] according to all the words which Jehovah had spoken with you on the mountain from the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly.

chapter.verse: And at the end of forty days and forty nights, Jehovah gave me the two tablets of stone, the Tablets of the Covenant.

verse.text: Then Jehovah said to me, Arise, go [xref]a[/xref]down quickly from here, for your people, whom you have brought out of Egypt, have spoiled [i]themselves;[/i] they have [xref]b[/xref]turned aside quickly from the way that I commanded them; they have made for themselves a molten image.
[xref]a[/xref]Then Jehovah spoke to me, saying, I have seen this people, and indeed they are a [xref]b[/xref]stiff-necked people.

chapter.verse: Let Me alone that I may destroy them and blot their name out from under heaven, and I will make of you a nation mightier and more numerous than they.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]So I turned and came down from the mountain, and the mountain was burning with [xref]b[/xref]fire, and the two Tablets of the Covenant were in my two hands.
And I [xref]a[/xref]saw that you had indeed sinned against Jehovah your God; you had made for yourselves a molten calf; you had turned aside quickly from the way that Jehovah had commanded you.

chapter.verse: And I took hold of the two tablets and cast them out of my two hands and shattered them before your eyes.

verse.text: Then I threw myself down before Jehovah as at the beginning, [xref]a[/xref]forty days and forty nights; I did not eat food nor drink water, because of all your sin which you had sinned by doing that which was evil in the sight of Jehovah so as to anger Him.

For I was [xref]a[/xref]afraid of the anger and the burning wrath with which Jehovah was angry [i]enough[/i] against you to destroy you. But Jehovah [xref]b[/xref]listened to me in that instance as well.

chapter.verse: And Jehovah was very angry with Aaron, [i]enough[/i] to destroy him. But I prayed also for Aaron at that time.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Then I took your sin that you had made, the calf, and I burned it with fire and crushed it, grinding it thoroughly until [i]it was[/i] as fine as dust; and I cast the dust of it into the brook that came down from the mountain.
And at [xref]a[/xref]Taberah, at [xref]b[/xref]Massah, and at [xref]c[/xref]Kibroth-hattaavah, you made Jehovah furious.

And when Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]sent you from Kadesh-barnea, saying, Go up and possess the land which I have given you, you rebelled at the word of Jehovah your God and did [xref]b[/xref]not believe Him and did not listen to His voice.

chapter.verse: You have been rebellious against Jehovah since the day I came to know you.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]So I threw myself down before Jehovah for the [xref]b[/xref]forty days and the forty nights; I threw myself down thus, for Jehovah had said He would destroy you.

[xref]a[/xref]And I prayed to Jehovah and said, O Lord Jehovah, do not destroy Your people and Your inheritance, whom You have ransomed with Your greatness, whom You have brought out of Egypt with a mighty hand.

chapter.verse: Remember Your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; do not look at the stubbornness of this people and at their wickedness and at their sin;

verse.text: Lest [i]the inhabitants of[/i] the land from which You have brought us out say, [xref]a[/xref]Because Jehovah was not able to bring them into the land which He promised them and because He hated them, He has brought them out to kill them in the wilderness.
But they are Your [xref]a[/xref]people and Your inheritance, whom You have brought out with Your great strength and with Your outstretched arm.

[xref]a[/xref]At that time Jehovah said to me, Cut for yourself two tablets of [xref]b[/xref]stone like the first ones, and come up to Me on the mountain; and make yourself an [xref]c[/xref]ark of wood.
And I will write upon the tablets the words which were on the first tablets, which you shattered; and you shall [xref]a[/xref]place them in the Ark.
So I made an ark of acacia wood and [xref]a[/xref]cut two tablets of stone like the first ones; and I went up to the mountain with the two tablets in my hand.

[xref]a[/xref]And He wrote upon the tablets as [i]He had done[/i] the first writing, the ten [note]1[/note]commandments, which Jehovah spoke to you on the mountain from the midst of the fire on the day of the assembly; and Jehovah gave them to me.
verse.note: Lit., words.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Then I turned and came down from the mountain, and I placed the [xref]b[/xref]tablets in the Ark that I had made. And there they have been, as Jehovah commanded me.

(And the children of Israel set out from [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Beeroth Bene-jaakan for Moserah. There Aaron [xref]b[/xref]died, and there he was buried; and Eleazar his son served as priest in his place.
verse.note: Or, the wells of the children of Jaakan.

chapter.verse: From there they set out for Gudgodah; and from Gudgodah to Jotbathah, a land of waterbrooks.

verse.text: At that time Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]separated the tribe of Levi to bear the Ark of the Covenant of Jehovah, to [xref]b[/xref]stand before Jehovah to minister to Him and bless in His name until this day.
Therefore Levi has [note]1[/note]no portion nor [xref]a[/xref]inheritance with his brothers; [note]1[/note]Jehovah is his inheritance, as Jehovah your God promised him.)
verse.note: See note [link]20[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 18[/link].

verse.text: And I stayed on the mountain, as [i]I had[/i] the first time, [xref]a[/xref]forty days and forty nights. And Jehovah listened to me in that instance as well; Jehovah would not destroy you.
And Jehovah said to me, [xref]a[/xref]Arise, take up the journey before the people so that they may enter and possess the land which I have sworn to their fathers to give them.

And now, O Israel, what does Jehovah your God ask of you except that you [xref]a[/xref]fear Jehovah your God so that you would [xref]b[/xref]walk in all His [note]1[/note]ways and [note]2[/note][xref]c[/xref]love Him and serve Jehovah your God with all your [note]3[/note]heart and with all your soul;
verse.note: God's ways are actually what God is. Whatever God is, is a way to us. Hence, to take what God is as our ways and to walk in these ways is to live God. The God who is our way is Christ ([link]John 14:6[/link]). To take Christ as our way is to live Him, and to live Him is to express Him, to manifest Him, and even to magnify Him ([link]Phil. 1:20-21a[/link]). In the New Jerusalem the river of water of life proceeding out of the throne of God and of the Lamb and flowing in the middle of the street of gold ([link]Rev. 22:1[/link]) indicates that God is both our life and our way. We take God as our life, and His life with His nature then becomes the way on which we walk. See note [link]1[sup]6[/sup] in Rev. 22[/link].

God Himself set an example of loving by setting His affection on His people ([link]vv. 14-15[/link]; [link]7:7-8[/link]). In Deuteronomy God was actually "courting" His people, loving them and setting His affection upon them (cf. note [link]6[sup]2[/sup] in Exo. 20[/link]). His people should love Him in return by setting their affection on Him. See note [link]9[sup]3[/sup] in 1 Cor. 2[/link].

Our heart is linked to our spirit, for our conscience, which is a function of our spirit ([link]Rom. 9:1[/link]), is also a function of our heart ([link]Heb. 10:22[/link]). Thus, to love and serve God with all our heart and soul indicates that we love and serve Him also with our spirit ([link]Rom. 1:9[/link]). Furthermore, according to [link]6:5[/link] we are to love Him also with all our might, that is, with our physical strength. See [link]Mark 12:28-30[/link] and note [link]30[sup]1[/sup][/link].

chapter.verse: So that you would keep the commandments of Jehovah and His statutes, which I am commanding you today, for your good.

verse.text: Behold, [xref]a[/xref]heaven and the heaven of heavens belong to Jehovah your God, the [xref]b[/xref]earth and all that is in it.
But on your fathers Jehovah set His [xref]a[/xref]affection to love them and to choose their seed after them, [i]that is,[/i] you above all the peoples, as [i]it is[/i] this day.
Circumcise then the foreskin of your [xref]a[/xref]heart, and do not be [xref]b[/xref]stiff-necked any longer;

For it is Jehovah your God who is the [xref]a[/xref]God of gods and the [xref]b[/xref]Lord of lords, the great God, [xref]c[/xref]mighty and awesome, who does [xref]d[/xref]not regard persons and does not take bribes;
He executes justice for the [xref]a[/xref]orphan and the widow, and He loves the sojourner, giving him food and clothing.
Therefore love the [xref]a[/xref]sojourner, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.
[xref]a[/xref]You shall fear Jehovah your God; Him shall you serve and to Him shall you [xref]b[/xref]hold fast and by His name shall you swear.
He is your [xref]a[/xref]praise and He is your God, who has done these great and awesome things for you, which your eyes have seen.
Your fathers went down into Egypt as [xref]a[/xref]seventy souls; and now Jehovah your God has made you as the [xref]b[/xref]stars of heaven in multitude.
Therefore you shall [xref]a[/xref]love Jehovah your God and keep His charge and His statutes and His ordinances and His commandments always.

chapter.verse: And realize today that [i]I am speaking[/i] not with your sons, who do not know and who have not seen the discipline of Jehovah your God, His greatness, His mighty hand and His outstretched arm;
And His signs and works, which He did in the midst of Egypt against Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and against all his land;

verse.text: And what He did to Egypt's forces, to their horses and to their chariots, when He caused the water of the Red Sea to flow [xref]a[/xref]over them while they were pursuing you; and Jehovah made them perish to this day;

chapter.verse: And what He did for you in the wilderness until you came to this place;

verse.text: And what He did to [xref]a[/xref]Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben, when the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them up and their households and their tents and all their substance that went with them, from the midst of all Israel.

chapter.verse: But it is your eyes that have seen all the great work of Jehovah which He did.

verse.text: Therefore you shall keep the whole commandment which I am commanding you today so that you may be [note]1[/note]strong and that you may go in and possess the land into which you are crossing over to possess,
verse.note: If we keep Christ and hold fast to Christ as God's whole commandment (see note [link]3[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link]), we will be strengthened and encouraged to go on to possess Christ ([link]vv. 8[/link], [link]24[/link]), i.e., to gain Christ ([link]Phil. 3:8[/link]); our days will be extended in Christ ([link]vv. 9[/link], [link]21[/link]); God's eyes will be upon us to care for us and give us the blessing of His presence ([link]v. 12[/link]); we will enjoy the heavenly rain, the watering of the Spirit, and reap a harvest of Christ ([link]vv. 14-15[/link]); and we will love God, walk in His ways, and hold fast to Him ([link]vv. 18-22[/link]).

verse.text: And so that you may extend your days upon the ground which Jehovah swore to your fathers, to give to them and to their seed, a land flowing with [xref]a[/xref]milk and honey.

For the land which you are entering in to possess is not like the land of Egypt, from which you came forth, where you used to sow your seed and [note]1[/note]water by foot as [i]in[/i] a vegetable garden.
verse.note: I.e., water with treadmills.

verse.text: But the land into which you are crossing over to possess is a [xref]a[/xref]land of mountains and valleys; by virtue of heaven's rain, it drinks in water.
[i]It is[/i] a land which Jehovah your God cares for; always the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]eyes of Jehovah your God are upon it, from the beginning of the year even to the end of the year.
verse.note: Because we are practically joined to Christ as the reality of the good land and are enjoying His riches (see note [link]7[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link]), God's eyes are upon us continually, causing us to enjoy God's presence and making us the object of His care.

verse.text: And if you are certain to listen to my commandments, which I am commanding you today, to [xref]a[/xref]love Jehovah your God and serve Him with all your heart and with all your soul,
I will give rain for your land in its season, the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]early rain and the late rain, so that you may gather your grain and your new wine and your fresh oil.
verse.note: See note [link]23[sup]1[/sup] in Joel 2[/link].

verse.text: And I will put grass in your field for your cattle, and you will eat and [xref]a[/xref]be satisfied.
Be careful lest your heart be deceived, and you turn aside and serve [xref]a[/xref]other gods and bow down to them,

And the anger of Jehovah burn against you and He [xref]a[/xref]shut up heaven, so that there is no rain and the earth does not yield its produce and you perish quickly from off the good land which Jehovah is giving you.
verse.xref: 1 Kings 8:35; 2 Chron. 6:26; 7:13; Rev. 11:6; Luke 4:25; cf. 1 Kings 17:1; Amos 4:7; Zech. 14:17

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Therefore you shall [note]1[/note]lay these words of mine on your heart and on your soul; and you shall bind them on your hand as a [xref]b[/xref]sign, and they shall be as frontlets between your eyes;
verse.note: Moses' words in [link]vv. 18-20[/link] can be applied to Christ and indicate that all the time and everywhere we should be occupied with Christ. We need to love God by laying Christ as the word on our heart and on our soul and by binding this word to everything related to us ([link]Col. 3:16[/link]).

verse.text: And you shall [xref]a[/xref]teach them to your children, speaking about them when you sit in your house and when you journey on the way, and when you lie down and when you rise up;
And you shall write them on the [xref]a[/xref]doorposts of your house and on your gates;

That your days may be multiplied, as well as the days of your children, upon the land which Jehovah swore to your fathers to give them, as long as the [xref]a[/xref]days of heaven are above the earth.
For if you are certain to keep all this commandment which I am commanding you to do, to [xref]a[/xref]love Jehovah your God, to walk in all His ways and hold fast to Him,
Jehovah will [xref]a[/xref]dispossess all these nations from before you, and you will dispossess nations greater and mightier than you.

[xref]a[/xref]Every place on which the sole of your [xref]b[/xref]foot treads will be yours; from the wilderness and Lebanon, from the [xref]c[/xref]river, the river Euphrates, even to the [note]1[/note]farmost sea will be your territory.
verse.note: I.e., the Mediterranean Sea. In this verse the boundaries of the land of Israel are set by God, from the Mediterranean Sea to the Euphrates in today's Iraq (cf. [link]Gen. 15:18[/link]; [link]Exo. 23:31[/link]). This will be fulfilled in the restoration of Israel, after the second coming of Christ ([link]Matt. 17:11[/link]; [link]19:28[/link]; [link]Acts 1:6[/link]; [link]3:21[/link]; [link]15:16[/link]).

verse.text: No man will be able to [xref]a[/xref]stand against you; Jehovah your God will put the dread and fear of you upon all the land on which you tread, as He has spoken to you.
See, I am [xref]a[/xref]setting before you today a [note]1[/note]blessing and a [note]1[/note]curse:
verse.note: If we love Christ and hold fast to Him, we will receive the blessing ([link]Eph. 6:24[/link]); if we do not, we will receive the curse ([link]1 Cor. 16:22[/link]).

chapter.verse: The blessing, if you listen to the commandments of Jehovah your God, which I am commanding you today;
And the curse, if you do not listen to the commandments of Jehovah your God and you turn aside from the way which I am commanding you today, to go after other gods whom you have not known.
