verse.text: And when Jehovah your God brings you into the land which you are entering to possess, you shall put the [xref]a[/xref]blessing upon [xref]b[/xref]Mount Gerizim and the curse upon Mount Ebal.

chapter.verse: Indeed they are across the Jordan beyond the western road in the land of the Canaanites, who dwell in the Arabah before Gilgal beside the terebinths of Moreh.
For you are about to cross over the Jordan to enter and possess the land which Jehovah your God is giving you; and you will possess it and dwell in it.
Therefore be certain to do all the statutes and ordinances that I am setting before you today.
These are the statutes and the ordinances that you shall be certain to do in the land which Jehovah, the God of your fathers, has given you to possess, all the days that you live on the earth.

verse.text: You shall completely [note]1[/note]destroy all the places where the nations whom you will dispossess have served their gods, on the high mountains and on the hills and under every flourishing tree.
verse.note: Before the children of Israel could have the full enjoyment of the riches of the good land, they had to utterly destroy the heathen places of worship, the idols, and the names of the idols ([link]vv. 2-3[/link]). Thus, the good land was to be thoroughly cleared of all the heathen centers of worship. The children of Israel were not to worship God in the same way that the nations worshipped their gods ([link]v. 4[/link]).

verse.text: And you shall [xref]a[/xref]tear down their altars and crush their pillars; and their Asherahs you shall burn with fire, and the idols of their gods you shall cut down; and you shall destroy their name from that place.

chapter.verse: You shall not do so to Jehovah your God.

verse.text: But to the [xref]a[/xref]place which Jehovah your God will [note]1[/note]choose out of all your tribes to put His [note]1[/note]name, to His [note]1[/note]habitation, shall you seek, and there shall you go.
verse.note: The children of Israel were not allowed to worship God and enjoy the offerings they presented to God in the place of their choice ([link]vv. 8[/link], [link]13[/link], [link]17[/link]). They were to worship God in the place of His choice, the place where His name, His habitation, and His altar were ([link]vv. 5-6[/link]), by bringing their tithes, offerings, and sacrifices to Him there ([link]vv. 5[/link], [link]11[/link], [link]14[/link], [link]18[/link], [link]21[/link], [link]26-27[/link]; [link]14:22-23[/link]; [link]15:19-20[/link]). To fulfill these requirements was to have a unique center of worship, as Jerusalem would be later ([link]2 Chron. 6:5-6[/link]; [link]John 4:20[/link]), for the keeping of the oneness among God's people, thus avoiding the division caused by man's preferences (cf. [link]1 Kings 12:26-33[/link] and notes).[br][br]The revelation in the New Testament concerning the worship of God corresponds to the revelation in this chapter in at least four ways: First, the people of God should always be one; there should be no divisions among them ([link]Psa. 133[/link]; [link]John 17:11[/link], [link]21-23[/link]; [link]1 Cor. 1:10[/link]; [link]Eph. 4:3[/link]). Second, the unique name into which God's people should gather is the name of the Lord Jesus Christ ([link]Matt. 18:20[/link]; [link]1 Cor. 1:12[/link] and notes), the reality of which name is the Spirit ([link]1 Cor. 12:3[/link]). To be designated by any other name is to be denominated, divided; this is spiritual fornication (see note [link]8[sup]3[/sup] in Rev. 3[/link]). Third, in the New Testament God's habitation, His dwelling place, is particularly located in our spirit, i.e., in our mingled spirit, our human spirit regenerated and indwelt by the divine Spirit ([link]John 3:6b[/link]; [link]Rom. 8:16[/link]; [link]2 Tim. 4:22[/link]; [link]Eph. 2:22[/link]). In our meeting for the worship of God, we must exercise our spirit and do everything in our spirit ([link]John 4:24[/link]; [link]1 Cor. 14:15[/link]). Fourth, in our worship of God we must have the genuine application of the cross of Christ, signified by the altar, by rejecting the flesh, the self, and the natural life and worshipping God with Christ and Christ alone ([link]Matt. 16:24[/link]; [link]Gal. 2:20[/link]). Hence, the meeting of God's people for the worship of God should be in the name of the Lord Jesus Christ, in the mingled spirit as the place of God's habitation, in the place where the cross is, and with the enjoyment of Christ as the reality of the tithes, the offerings, and the sacrifices (see note [link]24[sup]4[/sup] in John 4[/link]). This is the oneness of God's people, and this is the proper ground for the worship of God.

chapter.verse: And there you shall bring your burnt offerings and your sacrifices and your tithes and the heave offering of your hand and your vows and your freewill offerings and the firstborn of your herd and of your flock;
And there you shall eat before Jehovah your God, and you and your households shall rejoice in all your undertakings, in which Jehovah your God has blessed you.

verse.text: You shall not do according to all that we do here today, each man [xref]a[/xref][i]doing[/i] all that is right in his own eyes;
For until now you have not come to the [xref]a[/xref]rest and to the inheritance that Jehovah your God is giving you.

chapter.verse: But when you cross over the Jordan and dwell in the land which Jehovah your God is giving you as an inheritance, and when He gives you rest from all your enemies surrounding [i]you[/i] so that you dwell securely;

verse.text: Then to the [xref]a[/xref]place where Jehovah your God will choose to cause His name to dwell, there you shall bring all that I am commanding you, your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and the heave offering of your hand and all your choice vows which you vow to Jehovah.

And you shall rejoice before Jehovah your God, you and your sons and daughters, and your male servants and female servants, and the Levite who is within your gates, for he has [xref]a[/xref]no portion nor inheritance with you.

chapter.verse: Be careful that you do not offer up your burnt offerings in every place that you see;
But in the place which Jehovah will choose in one of your tribes, there you shall offer up your burnt offerings, and there you shall do all that I am commanding you.

verse.text: Yet you may slaughter and eat meat [xref]a[/xref]within all your gates, in all that your soul desires, according to the blessing of Jehovah your God which He has given you; the unclean and the clean may eat it as the gazelle and the deer [i]are eaten.[/i]
However, you shall not eat the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]blood; you shall pour it out upon the earth like water.
verse.note: See note [link]10[sup]1[/sup] in Lev. 17[/link].

verse.text: You may not [note]1[/note]eat within your gates the tithe of your grain or of your new wine or of your fresh oil, nor the firstborn of your herd or of your flock, or any of your vows which you vow or of your freewill offerings or of the heave offering of your hand;
verse.note: The children of Israel could enjoy the rich produce of the good land in two ways. The common, private way was to enjoy it as a common portion at any time, in any place, and with anyone ([link]v. 15[/link]). The special, corporate way was to enjoy the top portion, the firstfruits and the firstlings, with all the Israelites at the appointed feasts and in the unique place chosen by God (see note [link]5[sup]1[/sup][/link]). Likewise, the enjoyment of Christ by the New Testament believers is of two aspects — the common, private aspect of enjoying Christ at any time and at any place, and the special, corporate aspect of enjoying the top portion of Christ in the meetings of the proper church life on the unique ground of oneness, the place chosen by God.

chapter.verse: But you shall eat them before Jehovah your God in the place which Jehovah your God will choose, you and your son and daughter, and your male servant and female servant, and the Levite who is within your gates; and you shall rejoice before Jehovah your God in all your undertakings.

verse.text: Be careful that you do [xref]a[/xref]not forsake the Levite all your days upon the earth.

When Jehovah your God [xref]a[/xref]enlarges your territory, as He has promised you, and you say, I will eat meat, because your soul desires to eat meat, you may eat meat according to all that your soul desires.

chapter.verse: If the place where Jehovah your God will choose to put His name is too far away from you, you may slaughter from your herd and from your flock, which Jehovah has given you, as I have commanded you; and you may eat within your gates according to all that your soul desires;
Indeed, as the gazelle and the deer are eaten, so you may eat it; the unclean and the clean may eat it alike.

verse.text: But make sure that you do not eat the [note]1[/note]blood; for the [xref]a[/xref]blood is the [note]2[/note]life, and you shall not eat the life with the flesh.
verse.note: For [link]vv. 23-25[/link], see notes in [link]Lev. 17:10-14[/link].
Heb. [i]nephesh;[/i] lit., soul, living being.

chapter.verse: You shall not eat it; you shall pour it out upon the earth like water.
You shall not eat it, so that it may go well with you and with your children after you, when you do what is right in the sight of Jehovah.
But you shall take your holy things which you have and your vows, and go to the place which Jehovah will choose;

And you shall offer your burnt offerings, the flesh and the blood, upon the altar of Jehovah your God; and the blood of your sacrifices shall be poured out upon the altar of Jehovah your God, and you shall eat the flesh.

Keep and listen to all these words which I am commanding you so that it may go well with you and with your children after you forever, for you will be doing what is good and right in the sight of Jehovah your God.

verse.text: When Jehovah your God [xref]a[/xref]cuts off the nations before you, which you are entering to dispossess, and you dispossess them and dwell in their land,

Be careful that you are not [xref]a[/xref]ensnared in following them, after they have been destroyed before you, and that you do not seek after their gods, saying, How did these nations serve their gods, so that I also may do likewise?

chapter.verse: You shall not do so for Jehovah your God, for every abomination to Jehovah, which He hates, they have done to their gods; for even their sons and their daughters they have burned with fire to their gods.

verse.text: The whole thing that I am commanding you, you shall be certain to do; you shall [xref]a[/xref]not add to it, nor shall you take away from it.
If a [xref]a[/xref]prophet or a [xref]b[/xref]dreamer of dreams stands up in your midst and gives you a sign or wonder,
And the sign or the wonder occurs, about which he spoke to you, saying, [note]1[/note]Let us go after other gods whom you have not known, and let us serve them;
verse.note: Moses' word in [link]chs. 12[/link] and [link book="Deut."]13[/link] charges God's people to avoid division and reject apostasy. Apostasy in the Old Testament denotes giving up God and turning away from God to idols. In the New Testament apostasy is heresy, denoting the denial of Christ's deity; it refers to not believing that Jesus Christ is God incarnated to be a man ([link]John 1:1[/link], [link]14[/link]; [link]1 John 2:18[/link], [link]22[/link]; [link]4:2-3[/link]). Apostasy, or heresy, insults God and damages the person of Christ, and division destroys the Body of Christ as Christ's corporate expression. Thus, apostasy and division damage the entire economy of God. Because of this, the apostle Paul charges us to turn away from the divisive ones ([link]Rom. 16:17[/link]), and the apostle John enjoins us to reject the heretical ones ([link]2 John 9-11[/link]). Like Moses in this book and the apostles in the New Testament, we must be very strict concerning division and apostasy. We must keep the unique oneness of God's people and the unique faith in the person and redemptive work of Christ ([link]Eph. 4:3[/link], [link]13[/link] and notes [link]3[sup]1[/sup][/link] and [link]13[sup]2[/sup][/link]).

verse.text: You shall not listen to the words of that prophet or to that dreamer of dreams; for Jehovah your God is testing you in order to know whether you [xref]a[/xref]love Jehovah your God with all your heart and with all your soul.
You shall follow Jehovah your God; and you shall fear Him, keep His commandments, listen to His voice, serve Him, and [xref]a[/xref]hold fast to Him.

But that prophet or that dreamer of dreams shall be put to death, because he has advocated apostasy from Jehovah your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt and ransomed you from the slave house, in order to force you out of the way in which Jehovah your God has commanded you to walk. Thus you shall [note]1[/note]utterly [xref]a[/xref]remove the evil from your midst.
verse.note: Lit., burn out, consume. So throughout the book.

chapter.verse: If your brother, the son of your mother, or your son or daughter, or the wife of your bosom, or your friend who is like your [i]own[/i] soul [i]to you[/i] entice you secretly, saying, Let us go and serve other gods (which neither you nor your fathers have known,
Of the gods of the peoples who are surrounding you, those who are near you or those who are far from you, from one end of the earth to the other);
You shall not yield to him nor listen to him, nor shall your eye pity him; neither shall you spare [i]him[/i] nor conceal him;

verse.text: But you must slay him; [xref]a[/xref]your hand shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people.
And you shall [xref]a[/xref]stone him with stones so that he dies, because he sought to force you away from Jehovah your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the slave house.
And all Israel [xref]a[/xref]will hear and will fear and will never do [i]anything[/i] like this evil thing in your midst again.

chapter.verse: If you hear in one of your cities, which Jehovah your God is giving you to dwell in, [i]someone[/i] saying [i]that[/i]

verse.text: Some worthless men have [xref]a[/xref]gone out from your midst and have forced the inhabitants of their city, saying, Let us go and serve other gods (which you have not known);
Then you shall [xref]a[/xref]investigate and examine carefully and inquire thoroughly. And if indeed the thing is true [i]and[/i] certain — this abomination has been done in your midst —

chapter.verse: You must slay the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying it and all that is in it and its animals with the edge of the sword.

verse.text: And all its spoil you shall gather at the middle of its open square, and you shall [xref]a[/xref]burn the city and all its spoil with fire wholly to Jehovah your God. And it shall be a [xref]b[/xref]mound [i]only[/i] forever; it shall not be built again.

And nothing of what has been [xref]a[/xref]cursed shall cling to your hand, in order that Jehovah may turn from His burning anger and show you tenderness and be compassionate to you and multiply you as He swore to your fathers,

chapter.verse: When you listen to the voice of Jehovah your God and keep all His commandments, which I am commanding you today, and do what is right in the sight of Jehovah your God.

verse.text: [note]1[/note]You are the [xref]a[/xref]children of Jehovah your God; you shall [xref]b[/xref]not cut yourselves nor shave your forehead for the dead.
verse.note: The statutes and judgments presented in [link]14:1-26:19[/link] show how considerate, detailed, loving, tender, kind, merciful, gracious, sympathetic, humane, righteous, just, and fair God is. As those who have God's life, we, the believers in Christ, should learn of God to be the same as He is ([link]Eph. 5:1[/link]). We should walk before God and with God according to what He is. As we take God's way and what God is, we will be transformed into His image (cf. [link]2 Cor. 3:18[/link]). See note [link]16[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 26[/link].

verse.text: For you are a [xref]a[/xref]holy people to Jehovah your God, and Jehovah has chosen you to be a people for His [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]personal treasure, from among all the peoples which are upon the face of the earth.
verse.note: See note [link]5[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 19[/link].

verse.text: You shall not [note]1[/note]eat any abominable thing.
verse.note: In this chapter Moses turns from the matters of division and apostasy ([link]chs. 12[/link] and [link book="Deut."]13[/link]) to the matter of the holy diet. Eating signifies our contacting of people (see note [link]2[sup]1[/sup] in Lev. 11[/link]). Division and apostasy are related to our contact with others. In order to avoid both division and apostasy, we need to be discerning in our contact with people, as signified by the holy diet. We also need to protect our spiritual children from being destroyed by the divisive ones (see note [link]21[sup]1[/sup][/link]). For the details concerning the holy diet, see notes in [link]Lev. 11[/link].

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]These are the animals which you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat;

chapter.verse: The deer, the gazelle, the roebuck, the wild goat, the ibex, the antelope, the mountain sheep.

verse.text: And every animal that [note]1[/note]has a divided hoof, that is, has [i]its[/i] hoof split in two, [i]and[/i] that chews the cud among the animals, that you may eat.
verse.note: Lit., divides the hoof and cleaves the cleft of its two hooves.

verse.text: However, these you shall not eat of those that chew the cud or of those that [note]1[/note]have a cleft hoof: the camel, the hare, and the hyrax; because although they chew the cud, they do not have a divided hoof; they are unclean to you.
verse.note: Lit., divide the cleft hoof.

chapter.verse: And the pig, because although it has a divided hoof, [i]it does[/i] not [i]chew[/i] the cud; it is unclean to you. You shall not eat of their flesh, nor shall you touch their carcasses.
These you may eat of all that are in the water: Anything that has fins and scales you may eat,
But anything that does not have fins and scales you shall not eat; it is unclean to you.
You may eat any clean bird.
But these are what you shall not eat: the great vulture, the bearded vulture, and the black vulture;
The kite, the falcon, and the kite of every kind;
And all ravens of every kind;
The ostrich, the nighthawk, the sea gull, and the hawk of every kind;
The little owl, the great owl, the white owl,
The pelican, the carrion vulture, the cormorant,
The stork, the heron of every kind, the hoopoe, and the bat.

verse.text: And all [note]1[/note]flying insects are unclean to you; they shall not be eaten.
verse.note: Lit., winged swarming things.

chapter.verse: You may eat any clean flying animal.

verse.text: You shall not eat any [xref]a[/xref]carcass; to the sojourner who is within your gates you may give [i]it[/i] that he may eat it; or you may sell [i]it[/i] to a foreigner. For you are a holy people to Jehovah your God. [xref]b[/xref]You shall not [note]1[/note]boil a kid in its mother's milk.
verse.note: See note [link]19[sup]2[/sup] in Exo. 23[/link].

verse.text: You must [xref]a[/xref]give a tenth of all the produce of your seed, which the field brings forth, year by year.

[xref]a[/xref]And you shall eat [note]1[/note]before Jehovah your God, in the place where He will choose to cause His name to dwell, the tithe of your grain, of your new wine, and of your fresh oil and the firstborn of your herd and flock, that you may learn to fear Jehovah your God always.
verse.note: To eat before Jehovah is to eat with Him. The children of Israel enjoyed before God and with God the tithes that they had offered to God. This indicates that God wants us to enjoy His Christ with Him at His chosen place. See note [link]5[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 12[/link].

chapter.verse: But if the way is so far away from you that you are not able to carry [i]your tithe,[/i] because the place where Jehovah your God will choose to set His name is too far away from you when Jehovah your God has blessed you,

verse.text: Then you shall [xref]a[/xref]exchange [i]it[/i] for money and bind up the money in your hand, and you shall go to the place which Jehovah your God will choose.

chapter.verse: And you shall exchange the money for anything that your soul desires, for oxen, for sheep, for wine, for strong drink, or for anything that your soul would like; and you and your household shall eat there before Jehovah your God and rejoice.

verse.text: But you shall [xref]a[/xref]not forsake the Levite who is within your gates, for he has [xref]b[/xref]no portion nor inheritance with you.
At the end of [i]every[/i] [xref]a[/xref]three years you shall bring forth all the [note]1[/note]tithe of your produce for that year and lay it within your gates;
verse.note: God charged the children of Israel to offer Him the tithes yearly. In addition, during every three years they were to lay aside another tenth portion within their gates as a surplus to show the fullness of the rich produce of the good land. This tithe was to care for the poor and the Levites, the full-time serving ones ([link]v. 29[/link]; [link]26:12[/link]; cf. [link book="Deut." chapter="14"]v. 27[/link]; [link]Gal. 2:10[/link]; [link]1 Cor. 9:14[/link]; [link]1 Tim. 5:17-18[/link]). These verses concerning the aid to the needy show that God takes care of all His people, who are His expression. In like manner, Christ takes care of every member of His Body. See note [link]15[sup]2[/sup] in ch. 26[/link].

chapter.verse: And the Levite shall come — for he has no portion nor inheritance with you — as well as the sojourner and the orphan and the widow who are within your gates; and they shall eat and be satisfied, so that Jehovah your God may bless you in all the work of your hand which you do.

verse.text: At the end of [i]every[/i] [xref]a[/xref]seven years you shall issue a release.

chapter.verse: And this is the manner of the release: Every creditor shall release from his hand that which he has lent to his neighbor; he shall not exact it from his neighbor or his brother, for Jehovah's release has been proclaimed.

verse.text: From the [xref]a[/xref]foreigner you may exact [i]the debt;[/i] but whatever of yours your brother has, your hand shall release.

chapter.verse: However, there shall not be any needy among you (for Jehovah will surely bless you in the land which Jehovah your God is giving you as an inheritance to possess),
[i]But[/i] only if you carefully listen to the voice of Jehovah your God and are certain to do all this commandment which I am commanding you today.

verse.text: For Jehovah your God will bless you as He has promised you. And you will [xref]a[/xref]lend to many nations, but you will not borrow; and you will rule over many nations, but they will not rule over you.

If among you there is a [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]needy one amidst your brothers within any of your gates in your land, which Jehovah your God is giving you, you shall not harden your heart and you shall not close up your hand from your needy brother;
verse.note: Concerning the matter of lending (or, giving) to the needy ones and the blessing that follows, see [link]2 Cor. 9:6-15[/link].

verse.text: But you must [xref]a[/xref]open your hand to him, and you must lend enough for his need in whatever he lacks.

Be careful that there is not within your heart a base thought [note]1[/note]like this: The seventh year, the year of release, is near; and your [xref]a[/xref]eye be evil against your needy brother and you do not give him [i]anything,[/i] and he cry against you to Jehovah, and it become sin to you.
verse.note: Lit., saying.

verse.text: You must [xref]a[/xref]give to him, and your heart shall [xref]b[/xref]not be displeased when you give to him; for on account of this matter Jehovah your God will bless you in all your work and in all your undertakings.

For the [xref]a[/xref]needy will not cease [i]being[/i] in the land; therefore I am commanding you, saying, You must open your hand to your brother, to the [xref]b[/xref]poor one with you and to the needy one with you in your land.
[note]1[/note]If your brother, a [xref]a[/xref]Hebrew man or woman, is [xref]b[/xref]sold to you, he shall serve you six years; but in the seventh year you shall set him [note]2[/note]free.
verse.note: For [link]vv. 12-18[/link], see notes in [link]Exo. 21:2-6[/link].
Lit., free from with you. So throughout this chapter.

chapter.verse: And when you set him free, you shall not send him away empty-handed;
You must supply him richly from your flock and from your threshing floor and from your winepress; as Jehovah your God has blessed you, [i]so[/i] shall you give to him.

verse.text: And you shall [xref]a[/xref]remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt and [i]that[/i] Jehovah your God ransomed you; therefore I am commanding you this thing today.
[xref]a[/xref]And if he says to you, I will not go forth from you, because he loves you and your household, for it goes well with him [i]to be[/i] with you;

chapter.verse: Then you shall take an awl and run [i]it[/i] through his ear and into the door, and he shall be your servant forever; and thus also shall you do to your female servant.
You shall not view it as a hardship when you set him free; for he served you for six years, [i]saving you[/i] double the wages of a hired hand, and Jehovah your God will bless you in all that you do.

verse.text: All [xref]a[/xref]firstborn males that are brought forth in your herd and in your flock you shall sanctify to Jehovah your God; you shall not do work with your firstborn ox, nor shall you shear your firstborn sheep.
You and your household shall [xref]a[/xref]eat it before Jehovah your God year by year in the place which Jehovah will choose.
And if there is a [xref]a[/xref]blemish in it, lameness or blindness, any serious blemish, you shall not sacrifice it to Jehovah your God.
[xref]a[/xref]You shall eat it within your gates; the unclean and the clean alike [i]may eat it[/i] as the gazelle and the deer [i]are eaten.[/i]
However, you shall not eat its [xref]a[/xref]blood; you shall pour it out upon the earth like water.
Observe the month of [xref]a[/xref]Abib, and hold the [note]1[/note]Passover to Jehovah your God; for in the month of Abib Jehovah your God brought you out of Egypt by [xref]b[/xref]night.
verse.note: For the three main annual feasts, see notes in [link]Lev. 23[/link].

verse.text: And you shall sacrifice the passover to Jehovah your God, from the flock and from the herd, in the [xref]a[/xref]place where Jehovah will choose to cause His name to dwell.

You shall not eat anything leavened with it; seven days you shall eat [xref]a[/xref]unleavened bread with it, [i]that is,[/i] the bread of affliction (for in alarmed haste you came out of the land of Egypt); in order that you may [xref]b[/xref]remember the day of your coming out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life.

And [xref]a[/xref]leaven shall not be seen with you in all your territory for seven days, nor shall any of the flesh which you sacrifice in the evening on the first day remain until [xref]b[/xref]morning.

chapter.verse: You may not sacrifice the passover within any of your gates, which Jehovah your God is giving you;

verse.text: Rather, in the [xref]a[/xref]place where Jehovah your God will choose to cause His name to dwell, you shall sacrifice the passover in the [xref]b[/xref]evening, as the sun sets, at the time that you came out of Egypt.
And you shall cook and eat [i]it[/i] in the [xref]a[/xref]place which Jehovah your God will choose, and you shall turn in the morning and go to your tents.
Six days you shall eat [xref]a[/xref]unleavened bread. And on the seventh day there shall be a solemn assembly to Jehovah your God; you shall not do any work.
You shall count off for yourself [xref]a[/xref]seven weeks. You shall begin to count the seven weeks from [i]the time that you[/i] begin to put the sickle to the standing grain.
And you shall hold the [xref]a[/xref]Feast of Weeks to Jehovah your God according to the sufficiency of the freewill offering of your hand, which you will give, as Jehovah your God blesses you.

And you and your son and daughter, and your male servant and female servant, and the Levite who is within your gates and the sojourner and the orphan and the widow who are in your midst shall rejoice before Jehovah your God in the [xref]a[/xref]place where Jehovah your God will choose to cause His name to dwell.
And you shall [xref]a[/xref]remember that you were a slave in Egypt, and you shall keep and do these statutes.
You shall hold the [xref]a[/xref]Feast of [note]1[/note]Tabernacles for seven days after your [xref]b[/xref]ingathering from your threshing floor and your winepress.
verse.note: Lit., Booths. So also in [link]v. 16[/link]. See note [link]16[sup]2[/sup] in Exo. 23[/link].

chapter.verse: And you and your son and daughter, and your male servant and female servant, and the Levite and the sojourner and the orphan and the widow who are within your gates shall rejoice in your feast.

verse.text: You shall keep the feast to Jehovah your God for seven days in the [xref]a[/xref]place which Jehovah will choose, for Jehovah your God will bless you in all your produce and in all your undertakings; therefore you shall be nothing but joyful.

[xref]a[/xref]Three times a year all your males shall appear before Jehovah your God in the [xref]b[/xref]place which He will choose: at the Feast of Unleavened Bread, at the Feast of Weeks, and at the [xref]c[/xref]Feast of Tabernacles. And they shall not appear before Jehovah [xref]d[/xref]empty-handed;

chapter.verse: Each man [i]shall give[/i] as he is able to give, according to the blessing of Jehovah your God, which He has given you.

verse.text: You shall appoint for yourself [note]1[/note]judges and [xref]a[/xref]officers [note]2[/note]in all your cities which Jehovah your God is giving you, according to your tribes; and they shall judge the people with righteous [xref]b[/xref]judgment.
verse.note: The divine government among God's people is neither autocracy nor democracy but theocracy — a direct ruling and governing by God Himself according to what He is. Among the children of Israel in the Old Testament God governed His people according to His constant speaking, as written in the law, and His instant speaking, as revealed either through the breastplate of the high priest by means of the Urim and Thummim or through the prophets by the Spirit of God coming upon certain ones to enable them to speak God's word ([link]Exo. 28:30[/link] and notes; [link]Lev. 8:8[/link]; [link]Num. 27:21[/link]; [link]Deut. 33:8[/link]; [link]1 Sam. 28:6[/link]; [link]Ezra 2:63[/link]; [link]Neh. 7:65[/link]). Moreover, God's government was executed through some human agents: the priests and the elders, the judges, or the kings as direct administrators, who worked together for God's theocracy. In the church in the New Testament the teaching of the apostles ([link]Acts 2:42[/link]) replaces the law in God's administration, and the elders of the churches ([link]Acts 14:23[/link]; [link]Titus 1:5[/link]) are the direct administrators, who administrate according to the teaching of the apostles ([link]1 Tim. 3:2[/link]; [link]5:17[/link]). In relation to the instant speaking of the Lord, all the believers in Christ, including the elders, are priests to God ([link]1 Pet. 2:5[/link]; [link]Rev. 1:6[/link]), having Christ as the High Priest living within them ([link]Heb. 8:1[/link]; [link]Rom. 8:10[/link]) and having the Holy Spirit mingled with their regenerated human spirit ([link]Rom. 8:16[/link]) to replace the function of the Urim and Thummim. Among the believers, the prophets and teachers help the eldership and the priesthood ([link]Acts 13:1-4[/link]). See note [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in Ezra 5[/link].
Lit., within all your gates.

verse.text: You shall not distort justice; you shall [xref]a[/xref]not respect persons, nor shall you take a [xref]b[/xref]bribe, for a bribe blinds the eyes of the wise and perverts the words of the righteous.

chapter.verse: Righteousness, [i]and only[/i] righteousness, shall you pursue, in order that you may live and possess the land which Jehovah your God is giving you.

verse.text: You shall not plant for yourself an [note]1[/note]Asherah of any kind of tree beside the [note]1[/note]altar of Jehovah your God, which you will make for yourself;
verse.note: An Asherah was an image of a female deity, and the altar signifies the cross. To bring in certain pagan things and add them to the cross is to produce a mixture. See [link]Matt. 13:33[/link] and notes.

chapter.verse: Nor shall you erect for yourself a pillar, [i]something[/i] which Jehovah your God hates.

verse.text: You shall not sacrifice to Jehovah your God any ox or sheep in which there is a [xref]a[/xref]blemish, anything seriously wrong, for that is an abomination to Jehovah your God.

chapter.verse: If there is found in your midst, within any of your gates which Jehovah your God is giving you, a man or a woman who does what is evil in the sight of Jehovah your God by transgressing His covenant,

verse.text: And has gone and served other gods, and bowed down to them, that is, to the [xref]a[/xref]sun or the moon or any of the host of heaven, which I have not commanded [i]you to do;[/i]
And it is told to you and you hear [i]of it;[/i] then you shall [xref]a[/xref]investigate thoroughly. And if indeed the thing is true [i]and[/i] certain — this abomination has been done in Israel —
Then you shall bring out that man or that woman who has done this evil thing, to your gates, that very man or woman, and you shall [xref]a[/xref]stone them with stones so that they die.
At the word of [xref]a[/xref]two witnesses or three witnesses shall he who is to die be put to death; he shall not be put to death at the word of [i]only[/i] one witness.
The [xref]a[/xref]hand of the witnesses shall be first against him to put him to death, and afterward the hand of all the people. Thus you shall utterly [xref]b[/xref]remove the evil from your midst.

If a case is too complicated for you to judge between one kind of homicide and another, or between one kind of civil suit and another, or between one kind of assault and another, being disputed cases within your gates, then you shall arise and go up to the [xref]a[/xref]place which Jehovah your God will choose;

And you shall come to [note]1[/note]the Levitical priests and to the [xref]a[/xref]judge who is [i]presiding[/i] in those days and investigate [i]the matter;[/i] and they shall declare to you the sentence of judgment.
verse.note: Lit., the priests the Levites. So also elsewhere in this book. The investigation was conducted mainly by the priest. First, the priest went to God and stayed with God. Second, in the presence of God the priest would consider God's holy word. Third, the Levitical priests had the breastplate with the Urim and Thummim ([link]33:8[/link]), which provided instant enlightenment ([link]Exo. 28:30[/link] and notes). Eventually, through the presence of God, the word of God, and the Urim and Thummim, the priest would gain a clear understanding of the divine judgment and then pass on this judgment to the presiding judge. The judge would then make a judgment according to what the priest had received from God and passed on to him. The judgment of the case, therefore, came through man, but it was of God and according to God — a matter of theocracy. See note [link]18[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 16[/link].

verse.text: And you shall [xref]a[/xref]do according to the word of the sentence that they declare to you from that place which Jehovah will choose; and you shall be certain to do according to all that they instruct you.

chapter.verse: You shall do according to the word of the instruction with which they instruct you and according to the judgment which they speak to you; you shall not turn aside to the right or to the left from the sentence that they declare to you.

verse.text: And the man who acts [xref]a[/xref]presumptuously by not listening to the priest who stands to minister there before Jehovah your God, or to the judge, that man shall die. Thus you shall utterly [xref]b[/xref]remove the evil from Israel.

chapter.verse: And all the people will hear and will fear, and they will not act presumptuously anymore.

verse.text: When you enter the land which Jehovah your God is giving you, and you possess it and dwell in it, and you say, I will set a [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]king over me like all the nations which surround me;
verse.note: The people's desire to have a king, thus replacing God as their King, was offensive to God ([link]1 Sam. 8:4-7[/link] and note [link]7[sup]1[/sup][/link]).

verse.text: You must set a king over you whom Jehovah your God will [xref]a[/xref]choose; from among your brothers you shall set a king over you; you may not put a foreigner, who is not your brother, over you.

However, he shall not amass [note]1[/note]horses to himself, and he shall not turn the people back to [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Egypt so that he may amass horses, since Jehovah has said to you, You shall never again return that way.
verse.note: Egypt signifies the world, and horses signify the worldly means. If God's people use the worldly means or the worldly way, they will surely turn back to the world.
verse.xref: Deut. 28:68; Hosea 11:5; cf. Exo. 13:17; Num. 14:3-4; Jer. 42:15-19[br/]See note 16[sup]1[/sup].

verse.text: And he shall not amass [xref]a[/xref]wives to himself, so that his heart does not turn aside; nor shall he amass silver and gold to himself in great amounts.
And when he sits on the throne of his kingdom, he shall write out for himself a copy of this [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]law in a book, out of [i]that which is[/i] before the Levitical priests.
verse.note: The law here refers to the Pentateuch, the first five books of the Old Testament, which were written by Moses. In ruling over the people, the king first had to be instructed, governed, ruled, and controlled by the word of God. The principle should be the same with the elders in the churches. In order to administrate, to manage, the church, the elders must be reconstituted with the holy word of God ([link]1 Tim. 3:2[/link]; [link]5:17[/link]). As a result, they will be under God's government, under God's rule and control. Then spontaneously God will be in their decisions, and the elders will represent God to manage the affairs of the church. This kind of management is theocracy (see note [link]18[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 16[/link]).

chapter.verse: And it shall be with him, and he shall read in it all the days of his life, in order that he may learn to fear Jehovah his God by keeping all the words of this law and these statutes and doing them,

verse.text: So that his heart may not be lifted up above his brothers and he may not turn aside from the commandment to the right or to the left; that he and his sons may [xref]a[/xref]extend their days over their kingdom in the midst of Israel.

[xref]a[/xref]The [note]1[/note]Levitical priests [i]and[/i] the whole [note]1[/note]tribe of Levi shall have no portion or inheritance with Israel; they shall [xref]b[/xref]eat Jehovah's [xref]c[/xref]offerings by fire and His [note]2[/note]inheritance.
verse.note: Whereas the priests served God directly in His presence, the Levites were servants of the priests, coordinating with them and serving them by taking care of various practical matters. For the service of the priests and the Levites, see [link]Num. 3-4[/link] and notes.

God's inheritance consisted of the tithes offered to Him by the children of Israel. Some of these tithes were to be for the priests. Thus, the priests lived on the tithes offered to God by His people. See note [link]9[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 18[/link].

verse.text: Thus they shall have no inheritance in the midst of their brothers; [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Jehovah is their inheritance, as He has promised them.
verse.note: See note [link]20[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 18[/link].

verse.text: And this shall be the [note]1[/note]priests' rightful due from the people, from those who offer a sacrifice, whether an ox or a sheep: They shall give the priest the [xref]a[/xref]shoulder, the two cheeks, and the stomach.
verse.note: For the portion of the priests ([link]vv. 3-5[/link]), see [link]Num. 18:8-20[/link] and notes.

chapter.verse: You shall give him the first fruits of your grain, of your new wine, and of your fresh oil, and the first shearing of your sheep;

verse.text: For Jehovah your God has chosen him and his sons out of all your tribes to [xref]a[/xref]stand and minister in Jehovah's name always.
And if a [note]1[/note]Levite comes from any of your gates out of all Israel, where he sojourns, and comes according to all his soul's desire to the [xref]a[/xref]place which Jehovah will choose,
verse.note: The portion of the Levites was all the tithes of Israel. See [link]Num. 18:21-32[/link] and notes.

chapter.verse: He shall minister in the name of Jehovah his God, like all his brothers, the Levites, who stand there before Jehovah.

verse.text: They shall eat equal portions, besides the [note]1[/note]proceeds from the sale of his father's estate.
verse.note: The exact meaning of the Hebrew is uncertain.

chapter.verse: When you enter the land which Jehovah your God is giving you, you shall not learn to do [i]things[/i] according to the abominations of those nations.

verse.text: There shall not be found among you anyone who makes his son or daughter pass through fire; anyone who performs [xref]a[/xref]divination, practices soothsaying, or interprets omens; or anyone who employs sorcery

chapter.verse: Or casts spells; or anyone who consults a spirit of the dead or a familiar spirit or inquires of the dead;
For everyone who does these things is an abomination to Jehovah; and on account of these abominations Jehovah your God is dispossessing them from before you.

verse.text: You shall be [xref]a[/xref]blameless toward Jehovah your God.

chapter.verse: For these nations whom you are dispossessing listen to those who practice soothsaying and to those who perform divination, but Jehovah your God has not allowed you [i]to do[/i] so.

verse.text: A [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Prophet will Jehovah your God raise up for you from your midst, from among your brothers, like me; you shall [xref]b[/xref]listen to Him.
verse.note: [link]Acts 3:22[/link] applies [link]vv. 15-19[/link] to Christ, who is God incarnated to be a man, indicating that Christ is the Prophet promised by God to His people, the children of Israel. That the Prophet was to be from among their brothers ([link]v. 15a[/link]) indicates that Christ as the coming Prophet would be human as well as divine.

verse.text: [i]This is[/i] according to all that you asked of Jehovah your God at Horeb on the day of the assembly, saying, [xref]a[/xref]Let me not hear any more of the voice of Jehovah my God, and let me not see this great fire any longer, lest I die.
And Jehovah said to me, [xref]a[/xref]They have done well in what they have spoken.
A [xref]a[/xref]Prophet will I [note]1[/note]raise up for them from the midst of their brothers like you; and I will put My words in His mouth, and He will speak to them all that I command Him.
verse.note: God would raise up this Prophet through the incarnation of Christ to speak the word of God ([link]John 3:34[/link]; [link]7:16-17[/link]; [link]8:18[/link]; [link]Heb. 1:2a[/link]). To speak God's word, i.e., to prophesy, is to dispense God, to speak God forth into others (see [link]1 Cor. 14:1[/link], [link]3-5[/link], [link]24-25[/link], [link]31[/link] and notes [link]1[sup]3[/sup][/link], [link]3[sup]1[/sup][/link], [link]24[sup]1[/sup][/link], [link]25[sup]1[/sup][/link], and [link]31[sup]1[/sup][/link]). This is what the Lord Jesus did as the Prophet raised up by God.

verse.text: And the man who will [xref]a[/xref]not listen to My words which He will speak in My name, I Myself will require [i]it[/i] from him.
But the prophet who speaks a word presumptuously in My name, which I did not command him to speak, or who speaks in the name of other gods, that prophet shall [xref]a[/xref]die.

chapter.verse: And if you say in your heart, How shall we know the word that Jehovah has not spoken?

verse.text: When a prophet speaks in the name of Jehovah and the thing does [xref]a[/xref]not happen nor come about, that is the thing which Jehovah has not spoken. The prophet has spoken presumptuously; you shall not be afraid of him.
When Jehovah your God [xref]a[/xref]cuts off the nations whose land Jehovah your God is giving you and you dispossess them and dwell in their cities and in their houses,
You shall set apart [xref]a[/xref]three [note]1[/note]cities for yourself in the midst of your land, which Jehovah your God is giving you to possess.
verse.note: For [link]vv. 1-13[/link], see notes in [link]Num. 35:9-34[/link].

verse.text: You shall survey the distances for yourself and divide into three parts the territory of your land, which Jehovah your God will give you as an inheritance, so that every manslayer may [xref]a[/xref]flee there.

chapter.verse: And this shall be the case of the manslayer who flees there and lives: He who slays his neighbor without intent and did not hate him previously —

As when [i]a man[/i] goes with his neighbor into the forest to cut wood, and his hand goes to cut the tree with an axe, and the iron [i]axehead[/i] slips off the handle and hits his neighbor so that he dies — he shall flee to one of these cities and live;

verse.text: Lest the avenger of blood pursue the manslayer, while his heart rages, and he overtake him because the distance is long and [note]1[/note]slay him; though he is not worthy of death, for he did not hate him previously.
verse.note: Lit., slay him as regards the soul. So also in [link]v. 11[/link].

chapter.verse: Therefore I am commanding you, saying, You shall set apart three cities for yourself.

verse.text: And if Jehovah your God [xref]a[/xref]enlarges your territory, as He swore to your fathers, and gives you all the land which He promised to give to your fathers;

chapter.verse: If you are certain to do all this commandment which I am commanding you today, to love Jehovah your God and to walk in His ways always; then you shall add three more cities for yourself, besides these three,
That innocent blood may not be shed in the midst of your land, which Jehovah your God is giving you as an inheritance, and [i]guilt for[/i] blood be upon you.

verse.text: But if a man hates his neighbor and [xref]a[/xref]lies in wait for him, and he rises up against him and slays him so that he dies, and he flees to one of these cities;

chapter.verse: Then the elders of his city shall send [i]men[/i] and take him from there and deliver him into the hand of the avenger of blood, so that he may die.

verse.text: Your eye shall not pity him, but you shall [xref]a[/xref]remove the [i]guilt[/i] of innocent blood from Israel that it may go well with you.

You shall [xref]a[/xref]not move your neighbor's [note]1[/note]boundary marker, which [i]your[/i] ancestors have set, in your inheritance, which you will inherit in the land which Jehovah your God is giving you to possess.
verse.note: The land was eventually divided by lot ([link]Josh. 14:2[/link] and note), and boundary markers were set up. To move a boundary marker was to change God's ordination. This is abominable in the eyes of God. Instead of being greedy and invading another's portion, we should learn to be contented with the portion of Christ that God has ordained for us. Cf. [link]Rom. 12:3[/link]; [link]2 Cor. 10:13-16[/link].

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]One witness [i]only[/i] shall not rise up against a man for any iniquity or for any sin which he has committed; [xref]b[/xref]at the word of [xref]c[/xref]two witnesses or at the word of three witnesses shall a matter be established.
If a [xref]a[/xref]malicious witness rises up against a man to testify against him of wrongdoing,
The two men who have the dispute shall stand before Jehovah, before the [xref]a[/xref]priests and the judges who are [i]serving[/i] in those days.
And the judges shall [xref]a[/xref]investigate thoroughly; and if indeed the witness is a false witness, if he has testified falsely against his brother,

chapter.verse: You shall do to him as he intended to do to his brother. Thus you shall utterly remove the evil from your midst.

verse.text: And those who remain [xref]a[/xref]will hear and will fear and will never again do [i]anything[/i] like this evil thing in your midst.
And your eye shall not pity: a [xref]a[/xref]life for a life, an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth, a hand for a hand, a foot for a foot.

When you go forth into [note]1[/note]battle against your enemies, and you see horse and [xref]a[/xref]chariot, a people more numerous than you, you shall not fear them; for Jehovah your God is [xref]b[/xref]with you, He who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.
verse.note: The good land is a type of Christ (see note [link]7[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link]). Although Christ has been allotted to us by God as our portion ([link]Col. 1:12[/link]), if we would possess Christ and live in Christ as our land, we still need to fight against the spiritual enemies (see note [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 21[/link]). We should not only pray but also fight. Actually, we are not the ones fighting, for God goes with us and fights for us. It is our duty to fight, but we cannot fulfill this duty by ourselves but only by faith in the Lord, i.e., by the Lord Himself as our life and life supply. We can fulfill the Lord's requirements only by the divine life, the eternal life, which is the Triune God embodied in Christ ([link]John 14:6[/link]; [link]1 John 5:11-12[/link]), who is realized as the life-giving Spirit ([link]John 14:16-20[/link]; [link]1 Cor. 15:45[/link]). See note [link]3[sup]1[/sup], par. 2, in ch. 8[/link].

chapter.verse: And when you draw near to the battle, the priest shall approach and speak to the people,
And he shall say to them, Hear, O Israel! You are drawing near to the battle against your enemies today. Do not let your heart fail; do not be afraid or alarmed or terrified of them.

verse.text: For [i]it is[/i] Jehovah your God [i]who[/i] goes with you to [xref]a[/xref]fight for you against your enemies, to save you.

chapter.verse: And the officers shall speak to the people, saying, Is there any man who has built a new house and has not dedicated it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle and another man dedicate it.

verse.text: Is there any man who has planted a [xref]a[/xref]vineyard and has not [note]1[/note]partaken of it? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle and another man partake of it.
verse.note: Lit., brought it into common use (cf. [link]Lev. 19:23-25[/link]).

verse.text: Is there any man who has gotten engaged to a [xref]a[/xref]woman and has not taken her [i]to himself?[/i] Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle and another man take her [i]to himself.[/i]

And the officers shall speak further to the people and say, Is there any man who is [note]1[/note]afraid and whose heart fails? Let him go and return to his house, so that the heart of his brothers does not melt like his heart.
verse.note: If a fearful one had remained, he would have affected others, causing them to be afraid. The formation of Gideon's army is an illustration of this ([link]Judg. 7:3[/link]).

chapter.verse: And when the officers have finished speaking to the people, they shall appoint commanders of the armies at the head of the people.

verse.text: When you draw near to a city to fight against it, you shall proclaim [xref]a[/xref]peace to it.

chapter.verse: And if it responds with peace to you and opens [i]its gates[/i] to you, all the people found within it shall become your forced labor; and they shall serve you.
But if it does not make peace with you, but rather engages in battle with you, you shall besiege it.

verse.text: And when Jehovah your God delivers it into your hand, you shall [xref]a[/xref]slay every male in it with the edge of the sword.

But the [xref]a[/xref]women and the little ones and the beasts and all that is in the city, [i]that is,[/i] all its spoil, you shall take as your plunder; and you shall enjoy the spoil of your enemies, which Jehovah your God has given you.

chapter.verse: Thus shall you do to all the cities that are very far from you, which are not among the cities of these nations.
But of the cities of these peoples which Jehovah your God is giving you as an inheritance, you shall not allow anything that breathes to live;

verse.text: But you must utterly [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]destroy them: the [xref]b[/xref]Hittites and the Amorites, the Canaanites and the Perizzites, the Hivites and the Jebusites, just as Jehovah your God has commanded you,
verse.note: See note [link]2[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 7[/link].

verse.text: So that they do not teach you to do according to all their abominations which they do for their gods and you [xref]a[/xref]sin against Jehovah your God.

chapter.verse: When you besiege a city for many days, battling against it to capture it, you shall not destroy its trees by putting an axe to them; for you may eat of them, and you shall not cut them down. For is the tree of the field a man, that it should be besieged by you?
However, a tree that you know is not a tree for food, you shall destroy and cut down, so that you may build a siegework against the city, which engages you in battle, until it falls.
If a slain man is found lying in the field in the land which Jehovah your God is giving you to possess, it not being known who slew him,
Then your elders and judges shall go out and measure [i]the distance[/i] to the cities that surround the slain man.

verse.text: And the city that is nearest the slain man, [i]that is,[/i] the elders of that city, shall take a heifer of the herd which has not been worked and has not drawn the [xref]a[/xref]yoke;

chapter.verse: And the elders of that city shall bring the heifer down to a river valley that flows continually, which has not been plowed or sown, and break the neck of the heifer there in the river valley.

And the priests, the sons of Levi, shall draw near; for Jehovah your God has chosen them to minister to Him and to bless in the name of Jehovah, and by their word shall every dispute and every assault be [i]settled.[/i]

verse.text: And all the elders of that city that is nearest the slain man shall [xref]a[/xref]wash their hands over the heifer whose neck was broken in the river valley.

chapter.verse: And they shall answer and say, Our hands have not shed this blood, nor have our eyes seen [i]it done.[/i]

verse.text: Cover Your people Israel, whom You have ransomed, O Jehovah, and do not set [i]the guilt of[/i] [xref]a[/xref]innocent blood in the midst of Your people Israel. And [i]the guilt[/i] of the blood shall be covered from them.
Thus you shall utterly [xref]a[/xref]remove [i]the guilt of[/i] the innocent blood from your midst, for you do what is right in the sight of Jehovah.

chapter.verse: When you go out to fight against your enemies and Jehovah your God delivers them into your hands and you take them captive,
And you see a beautiful woman among the captives and desire her and would take her to yourself as a wife;

verse.text: You shall bring her within your house, and she shall [xref]a[/xref]shave her head, trim her nails,

And take her clothes of captivity away from her. And she shall dwell in your house and mourn her [xref]a[/xref]father and mother for a full month. And afterward you shall go in unto her and be her husband, and she shall be a wife to you.

And if [i]after a time[/i] you do not delight in her, you shall let her go [xref]a[/xref]wherever she wishes. But you must not sell her for money; you shall not deal with her as a slave, because you have humbled her.
If a man has two wives, one beloved and the other despised, and both the [xref]a[/xref]beloved and the despised have borne him sons; and [i]if[/i] the firstborn son is of the despised woman;

chapter.verse: Then in the day when he gives what he has to his sons as his inheritance, he may not make the son of the beloved woman the firstborn instead of the son of the despised one, [i]who is[/i] the firstborn.

verse.text: But he shall acknowledge the firstborn, the son of the despised woman, giving him a double portion of all that he has, for he is the [xref]a[/xref]firstfruits of his vigor; the right of the firstborn is his.
If a man has a stubborn and rebellious son, one who does not listen to the voice of his father nor to the voice of his mother; and though they [xref]a[/xref]chastise him, he does not listen to them;

chapter.verse: Then his father and mother shall seize him and bring him forth to the elders of his city and to the gate of his place.
And they shall say to the elders of his city, This son of ours is stubborn and rebellious; he does not listen to our voice; he is a glutton and a drunkard.

verse.text: Then all the men of his city shall [xref]a[/xref]stone him with stones so that he dies. Thus you shall utterly [xref]b[/xref]remove the evil from your midst, and all Israel will hear and will fear.
And if in a man there is a sin, a cause [i]worthy[/i] of death, and he is put to death, and you [note]1[/note]hang him on a tree;
verse.note: The one hanged on a tree here is a type of the crucified Christ, who was cursed and hanged on the cross to redeem us out of the curse of the law ([link]Gal. 3:13[/link]; [link]1 Pet. 2:24[/link]) and was buried on the day of His death ([link]v. 23[/link]; [link]John 19:31[/link]).

verse.text: His [xref]a[/xref]corpse shall not remain overnight on the tree, but you must bury him on that day. For he who is hanged is [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]accursed of God, and you shall not defile your land, which Jehovah your God gives you as an inheritance.
verse.note: Lit., the curse of God.

verse.text: You shall not see your brother's ox or his sheep straying and neglect them; you must [xref]a[/xref]return them to your brother.

chapter.verse: And if your brother is not nearby you, or if you do not know [i]who[/i] he [i]is,[/i] you shall bring it to your house. And it shall be with you until your brother demands it; then you shall return it to him.

And thus shall you do with his donkey; and thus shall you do with his clothing; and thus shall you do with any of your brother's lost things, which he has lost and you have found. You may not neglect them.

verse.text: You shall not see your brother's donkey or his ox fallen by the way and neglect them; you must [xref]a[/xref]lift [i]them[/i] up with him.

chapter.verse: A woman shall not put on a man's clothing, nor shall a man wear a woman's garment; for everyone who does these things is an abomination to Jehovah your God.

verse.text: If you happen to come upon a bird's nest in the way, in any tree or on the ground, [i]and in it are[/i] young birds or eggs, and the mother sitting upon the young birds or upon the eggs, you shall not take the [xref]a[/xref]mother with the young.

chapter.verse: You must let the mother go, but the young you may take for yourself, that it may go well with you and that you may extend [i]your[/i] days.
When you build a new house, you shall make a low wall around the edge of your roof so that you do not put the guilt of blood on your house if someone falls from it.

verse.text: You shall not sow your vineyard with [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]two kinds [i]of seed,[/i] lest the full produce, the seed which you sow, be forfeited to the sanctuary, as well as the increase of the vineyard.
verse.note: The prohibition against sowing two kinds of seed in one's vineyard may typify the prohibition against teaching differently in the church ([link]1 Tim. 1:3-4[/link]; [link]6:3[/link]; cf. [link]Luke 8:11[/link]). The church is God's vineyard (cf. [link]1 Cor. 3:9b[/link]), and in this vineyard only one kind of seed, one kind of teaching, should be sown ([link]Acts 2:42[/link] and note). If we teach differently, sowing more than one kind of seed, the "produce" in the church will be forfeited.

verse.text: You shall not [note]1[/note]plow with an ox and a donkey [xref]a[/xref]together.
verse.note: The prohibition against plowing with an ox and a donkey together typifies the prohibition against becoming dissimilarly yoked with unbelievers ([link]2 Cor. 6:14a[/link] and note 2). In this verse an ox, a clean animal, typifies a believer, and a donkey, being unclean, typifies an unbeliever ([link]Lev. 11:3-4a[/link]).

verse.text: You shall not wear [i]clothing[/i] of [xref]a[/xref]mixed materials, of wool and linen together.
You shall make [note]1[/note]twisted cords upon the four [xref]a[/xref]corners of your garment with which you cover yourself.
verse.note: The requirement here may refer to what is mentioned in [link]Num. 15:38[/link] (see notes there).

verse.text: If a man takes a wife and goes in unto her, and [i]later[/i] [note]1[/note]despises her,
verse.note: Or, hates.

chapter.verse: And charges her with shameful deeds and spreads an evil report about her, and says, I took this woman, and when I drew near to her, I did not find her to be a virgin;
Then the girl's father and her mother shall take and bring forth the evidence of the girl's virginity to the elders of the city at the gate.
And the girl's father shall say to the elders, I gave my daughter to this man as a wife, but he despised her;

And now he charges her with shameful deeds, saying, I did not find your daughter to be a virgin. But this is the evidence of my daughter's virginity. And they shall spread the cloth before the elders of the city.
Then the elders of that city shall take the man and chastise him;

verse.text: And they shall fine him one hundred [i]shekels[/i] of silver and give it to the girl's father, for he spread an evil report against a virgin of Israel. And she shall be his wife; he may [xref]a[/xref]not send her away all his days.

chapter.verse: But if this claim is true — the girl was not found to be a virgin —

verse.text: They shall bring the girl out to the entrance of her father's house, and the men of her city shall stone her with stones so that she dies; for she has done [xref]a[/xref]folly in Israel by committing fornication in her father's house. Thus you shall utterly [xref]b[/xref]remove the evil from your midst.

chapter.verse: If a man is found lying with a woman married to a husband, both of them shall die, the man who was lying with the woman and the woman. Thus you shall utterly remove the evil from Israel.
If a girl [i]who is[/i] a virgin is engaged to a man, and a man finds her in the city and lies with her;

verse.text: You shall bring both of them out to the gate of that city and [xref]a[/xref]stone them with stones so that they die, the girl because she did not cry out in the city, and the man because he humbled his neighbor's wife. Thus you shall utterly remove the evil from your midst.

chapter.verse: But if the man finds the engaged girl in the field, and the man overpowers her and lies with her, only the man who was lying with her shall die.

verse.text: But to the girl you shall not do anything; there is no sin [i]worthy[/i] of death with the girl; for as [i]it is[/i] when a man rises up against his neighbor and [note]1[/note]slays him, so is this matter.
verse.note: Lit., slays him as regards the soul.

chapter.verse: For he found her in the field; the engaged girl cried out and there was no one to save her.
If a man finds a girl [i]who is[/i] a virgin and is not engaged, and seizes her and lies with her, and they are found;
The man who was lying with her shall give fifty [i]shekels[/i] of silver to the girl's father. And she shall be his wife, because he humbled her; he may not send her away all his days.

verse.text: A man shall not take his [xref]a[/xref]father's wife, so that he does not uncover the skirt of his father's garment.
He who has been [note]1[/note]wounded in the testicles or has the male organ cut off shall not enter the congregation of Jehovah.
verse.note: The congregation of Jehovah typifies the church. In the persons mentioned in this verse, the power to produce had been destroyed. This prohibition indicates that those who are barren, those who do not produce and bear fruit, will lose their right to enter the church life. Cf. [link]John 15:2a[/link].

chapter.verse: An illegitimate child shall not enter the congregation of Jehovah; even to the tenth generation, no [i]descendant[/i] of his shall enter the congregation of Jehovah.

verse.text: An [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Ammonite or a [note]1[/note]Moabite shall not enter the congregation of Jehovah; even to the [xref]b[/xref]tenth generation, no [i]descendant[/i] of theirs shall enter the congregation of Jehovah forever;
verse.note: See note [link]37[sup]2[/sup], par. 1, in Gen. 19[/link].

verse.text: Because they did not come to meet you with bread and water in the way when you were coming out of Egypt, and because they hired [xref]a[/xref]Balaam the son of Beor from Pethor of Mesopotamia against you, to curse you.
But Jehovah your God would not listen to Balaam, and Jehovah your God turned the [xref]a[/xref]curse into a blessing for you, for Jehovah your God loved you.
[xref]a[/xref]You shall not seek peace with them nor prosperity with them all your days forever.
You shall not abhor an [note]1[/note]Edomite, for he is your brother. You shall not abhor an Egyptian, for you were a sojourner in his land.
verse.note: The Edomites were the descendants of Esau, the brother of Jacob ([link]Gen. 36:1[/link]). See note [link]14[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 20[/link].

chapter.verse: The children of the third generation who have been begotten of them may enter the congregation of Jehovah.
When you as a camp go forth against your enemies, you shall keep yourself from every evil thing.
If there is among you a man who becomes unclean because of an accident in the night, he shall go outside the camp; he shall not enter into the midst of the camp.
But when evening approaches, he shall bathe in water; and when the sun goes down, he shall enter into the midst of the camp.
And you shall have an assigned place outside the camp, and there you shall go out;
And you shall have a spade among your tools, and when you relieve yourself outside [i]the camp,[/i] you shall dig with it and turn to cover your excrement.

verse.text: For Jehovah your God [xref]a[/xref]walks in the midst of your camp to rescue you and deliver up your enemies before you; therefore your camp shall be holy, and He must not see any indecent thing among you, lest He turn back from [i]going[/i] after you.
You shall not [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]deliver to his master the slave who has escaped from his master to you;
verse.note: This reveals the kind of heart our God has. God's heart is always willing to forgive and to release, not to condemn ([link]John 3:16-17[/link]; [link]8:10-11[/link]; [link]Luke 23:34[/link]; [link]1 John 1:9[/link]). This indicates that we should have the heart to forgive our brothers in the Lord ([link]Matt. 18:21-22[/link]; [link]Mark 11:25[/link]; [link]Luke 17:3-4[/link]; [link]Eph. 4:32[/link]; [link]Col. 3:13[/link]).

chapter.verse: He shall dwell with you, [i]even[/i] in your midst, in the place which he chooses among your towns, wherever he pleases; you shall not oppress him.
There shall not be a cult prostitute among the daughters of Israel, nor shall there be a cult prostitute among the sons of Israel.

verse.text: You shall not bring the payment for a harlot or the price for a [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]dog into the house of Jehovah your God for any vow, for both of them are an abomination to Jehovah your God.
verse.note: I.e., a male prostitute.

chapter.verse: You shall not make your brother pay interest, interest on money, interest on food, interest on anything on which one pays interest.

verse.text: You may make a [xref]a[/xref]foreigner pay interest; but you shall not make your brother pay interest, in order that Jehovah your God may bless you in all your undertakings upon the land which you are entering to possess.
[xref]a[/xref]When you vow a [note]1[/note]vow to Jehovah your God, you shall not delay in paying it; for Jehovah your God would certainly require it of you, and it will become sin in you.
verse.note: See note [link]30[sup]1[/sup], par. 2, in Lev. 27[/link].

chapter.verse: But if you refrain from vowing, it will not become sin in you.
What proceeds out of your lips you shall keep and do, as you have vowed to Jehovah your God voluntarily, which you have promised with your mouth.

verse.text: When you enter your neighbor's vineyard, you may eat grapes as your soul [i]desires, until[/i] you are satisfied; but you shall not put [i]any[/i] into a [note]1[/note]vessel of yours.
verse.note: The statutes in [link]vv. 24-25[/link] indicate that we should care only for our need and should not be greedy. We must learn to be restricted in any kind of seeking, including our spiritual seeking.

verse.text: When you go into your neighbor's standing grain, you may pluck some [xref]a[/xref]ears with your hand; but you shall not wield a sickle upon your neighbor's standing grain.

When a man takes a woman and marries her, if she does not find favor in his sight, because he has found some indecency in her; and he writes her a [xref]a[/xref]bill of divorce and puts [i]it[/i] in her hand and sends her away from his house;

chapter.verse: And she goes forth from his house and goes to be another man's;
And the latter husband despises her and writes her a bill of divorce and puts it in her hand and sends her away from his house; or if the latter husband, who has taken her as his wife, dies;

verse.text: Then the former husband, who sent her away, may [xref]a[/xref]not return to take her [i]again[/i] to be his wife after she has been defiled. For that is an abomination before Jehovah, and you shall not cause the land to sin, which Jehovah your God is giving you as an inheritance.

When a man takes a new [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]wife, he shall not go out with the army, nor shall he be charged with any duty; he shall be free at home for one year, and he shall make his wife happy, whom he has taken.
verse.note: Marriage is for human existence and for human reproduction (cf. [link]Gen. 1:28[/link]). God honors marriage and abhors anything that would damage marriage.

chapter.verse: One shall not take a handmill or an upper millstone as a pledge, for he takes the livelihood as a pledge.

verse.text: If a man is found [xref]a[/xref]kidnapping someone from among his brothers of the children of Israel and deals with him as a slave or sells him, then that kidnapper shall die. Thus you shall utterly [xref]b[/xref]remove the evil from your midst.
Be careful in a case of [xref]a[/xref]leprosy to carefully keep and do all that the Levitical priests instruct you; as I commanded them, so shall you be certain to do.
Remember what Jehovah your God did to [xref]a[/xref]Miriam on the way when you came out of Egypt.

chapter.verse: When you lend anything to your neighbor, you shall not enter his house in order to take his pledge.
You shall stand outside, and the man to whom you are lending shall bring the pledge out to you.
And if he is a poor man, you shall not sleep with his pledge;

verse.text: You must [xref]a[/xref]return his pledge to him when the sun goes down, so that he may sleep in his mantle and bless you; and it will be righteousness to you before Jehovah your God.

chapter.verse: You shall not oppress a poor and needy hired servant among your brothers or among the sojourners with you, who are in your land within your gates.

verse.text: On the day he [i]earns it,[/i] you shall give him his [xref]a[/xref]wages, and the [xref]b[/xref]sun shall not go down upon it (for he is poor and his life depends on it); lest he cry against you to Jehovah and it become sin in you.

[note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Fathers shall not be put to death because of [i]their[/i] children, nor shall children be put to death because of [i]their[/i] fathers; every man shall be put to death for his [i]own[/i] sin.
verse.note: This judgment reveals God's justice. All the points concerning the divine government among the children of Israel show us that God is a God of justice. As a God of justice, God will not allow anything unjust to be among His people.

chapter.verse: You shall not distort justice [i]due[/i] a sojourner [i]or[/i] an orphan, nor shall you take a widow's garment as a pledge.

verse.text: But you shall [xref]a[/xref]remember that you were a slave in Egypt and [i]that[/i] Jehovah your God ransomed you from there; therefore I am commanding you to do this thing.

When you reap your harvest in your field and you forget a sheaf in the field, you shall not turn back to [xref]a[/xref]gather it; it shall be for the sojourner, the orphan, and the widow, in order that Jehovah your God may bless you in all your undertakings.

chapter.verse: When you beat down the fruit of your olive tree, you shall not go over the boughs afterward; it shall be for the sojourner, the orphan, and the widow.
When you cut [i]the grapes from[/i] your vineyard, you shall not glean afterward; it shall be for the sojourner, the orphan, and the widow.

verse.text: And you shall [xref]a[/xref]remember that you were a slave in the land of Egypt; therefore I am commanding you to do this thing.
[xref]a[/xref]If there is a dispute between men, and they approach the court, and [i]the judges[/i] judge them, they shall [xref]b[/xref]justify the righteous and condemn the wicked.
And if the wicked man is worthy of beating, the judge shall make him lie down and have him [xref]a[/xref]beaten before him as is sufficient for his wickedness, by number.
[xref]a[/xref]Forty blows he may give him; he shall not exceed, lest, in exceeding, he beat him beyond these with many blows and your brother be [note]1[/note]degraded before your eyes.
verse.note: If we must speak about a brother's wrongdoing, we should be restrained and be careful not to exaggerate. Since every brother is precious to the Lord Jesus and is treasured by Him, having been purchased by Him with His blood, a great price ([link]1 Pet. 1:18-19[/link]), it is sinful to degrade a brother by criticizing him or by speaking excessively of his wrongdoing.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]You shall not muzzle an ox while it treads out [i]grain.[/i]

If brothers dwell together, and one of them dies, and he has no son, the [xref]a[/xref]wife of the deceased man shall not become the wife of a stranger outside [i]the family;[/i] her husband's brother shall go in unto her and take her as his wife, and he shall do the [xref]b[/xref]duty of a husband's brother for her.
And the firstborn whom she bears shall [note]1[/note]assume the [xref]a[/xref]name of his deceased brother, so that his name is not blotted out of Israel.
verse.note: This judgment reveals God's love, for in His love for the one who died, God wanted the name of that one to be preserved among the people. Applied spiritually, this judgment also reveals that God wants us to be spiritually productive. On the one hand, we all need to have spiritual children as our successors; on the other hand, we need to help our brothers in the Lord to have spiritual children.

verse.text: And if the man does not desire to take his brother's wife, his brother's wife shall go up to the [xref]a[/xref]gate to the elders and say, My husband's brother refuses to raise up a name in Israel to his brother; he is not willing to do the duty of a husband's brother for me.
Then the elders of his city shall call him and speak to him. And [i]if[/i] he persists and says, I do [xref]a[/xref]not desire to take her;

Then his brother's wife shall draw near to him in the sight of the elders and remove his [xref]a[/xref]sandal from off his foot, and she shall spit in his face and respond and say, Thus shall it be done to the man who does not build up his brother's house.

chapter.verse: And his name shall be called in Israel, The house of him whose sandal has been removed.

When [i]two[/i] men fight together, a man and his brother, and the wife of the one comes near to rescue her husband from the hand of him who is beating him, and she puts forth her hand and takes hold of his private parts;
Then you shall cut off her hand; your eye shall not pity [i]her.[/i]

verse.text: You shall not have in your bag [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]differing weights, one heavy and one light.
verse.note: The dishonest practice of having differing weights and measures is a lie and is surely from Satan ([link]John 8:44[/link]). In spiritual application, to condemn a certain thing in others while justifying the same thing in ourselves indicates that we have different weights and measures, i.e., different scales — one scale for measuring others and a different scale for measuring ourselves. In the house of God, the church ([link]1 Tim. 3:15[/link]), only one scale should be used to weigh everyone. If we have only one scale, we will be fair, righteous, and just, even as God is, and we will keep the oneness and one accord in the church. Cf. [link]Matt. 7:1-5[/link] and notes.

verse.text: You shall not have in your house [xref]a[/xref]differing measures, one large and one small.

A full and righteous weight you shall have, [i]and[/i] a full and righteous measure you shall have, in order that your days may be [xref]a[/xref]extended upon the land which Jehovah your God is giving you.

chapter.verse: For everyone who does these things, everyone who does unrighteousness, is an abomination to Jehovah your God.

verse.text: Remember what [xref]a[/xref]Amalek did to you on the way when you came out of Egypt,

chapter.verse: That he met you on the way and struck you at the rear, [i]struck[/i] all those who were worn out at your rear, when you were faint and weary; and he did not fear God.

verse.text: Therefore when Jehovah your God gives you rest from all your enemies surrounding [i]you,[/i] in the land which Jehovah your God is giving you as an inheritance to possess, you shall blot out the [xref]a[/xref]memory of Amalek from under heaven; you shall not forget.

chapter.verse: And when you enter the land which Jehovah your God is giving you as an inheritance, and you possess it and dwell in it,

verse.text: You shall take some of the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]first of all the fruit of the ground which you shall bring from your land, which Jehovah your God is giving you, and you shall put [i]it[/i] in a basket and go to the [xref]b[/xref]place where Jehovah your God will choose to cause His name to dwell.
verse.note: This offering was something in addition to the tithes ([link]14:22-27[/link]). Like the tithes, a portion of the first of all the fruit was to be offered to God and enjoyed with God in the place which God would choose. See note [link]5[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 12[/link].

chapter.verse: And you shall go to the priest who is [i]serving[/i] in those days and say to him, I declare to Jehovah your God today that I have entered the land which Jehovah swore to our fathers to give us.
And the priest shall take the basket from your hand and place it before the altar of Jehovah your God.
