verse.text: And you shall respond and say before Jehovah your God, A [note]1[/note]perishing [xref]a[/xref]Aramaean was my father; and he went down to [xref]b[/xref]Egypt and sojourned there, few in number; and he became there a great and mighty and numerous nation.
verse.note: Or, wandering.

verse.text: And the Egyptians [xref]a[/xref]ill-treated us and afflicted us and put hard work upon us;
But we [xref]a[/xref]cried out to Jehovah, the God of our fathers, and Jehovah heard our voice, and saw our affliction and our labor and our oppression.
And Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and by great terror and by signs and wonders.
And He has brought us to this place and has [xref]a[/xref]given us this land, a land flowing with [xref]b[/xref]milk and honey.

And now I have just brought the [xref]a[/xref]first of the fruit of the ground, which You, O Jehovah, have given me. And you shall place it before Jehovah your God and bow down before Jehovah your God.
And you and the Levite and the sojourner in your midst shall [xref]a[/xref]rejoice in all the good which Jehovah your God has given to you and to your household.

When you have finished giving all the [note]1[/note]tithes of your produce in the [xref]a[/xref]third year, the year of the [xref]b[/xref]tithe, you shall give [i]it[/i] to the Levite, the sojourner, the orphan, and the widow, that they may eat within your gates and be satisfied.
verse.note: See note [link]28[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 14[/link].

chapter.verse: And you shall say before Jehovah your God, I have removed what is holy from out of my house, and I have also given it to the Levite and the sojourner, to the orphan and the widow, according to Your whole commandment, which You have commanded me; I have not transgressed any of Your commandments and I have not forgotten [i]them.[/i]

I have not eaten any of it in my sorrow, nor have I removed any of it while [i]I was[/i] unclean, nor have I given any of it to the dead. I have listened to the voice of Jehovah my God; I have done according to all that You have commanded me.

verse.text: Look down from [note]1[/note]Your [xref]a[/xref]holy habitation, from heaven, and [note]2[/note]bless Your people Israel and the ground which You have given us, as You swore to our fathers, a land flowing with [xref]b[/xref]milk and honey.
verse.note: Or, the habitation of Your holiness.

This indicates that if we, for the sake of God, take care of the needy ones in the church, God will surely bless our labor and undertakings. This blessing will be a return to us from God (cf. [link]2 Cor. 9:6[/link]). Apparently we are giving; actually we are receiving. Nevertheless, to give is much more blessed than to receive ([link]Acts 20:35[/link]).

verse.text: This day Jehovah your God is commanding you to [note]1[/note]do these statutes and ordinances; therefore you shall keep them and do them with all your heart and with all your soul.
verse.note: In this section of the rehearsal of the law ([link]14:1-26:19[/link]) five governing principles of our behavior are implied: (1) toward God, to be sanctified and fearing; (2) toward oneself, to be righteous and pure; (3) toward others, to be kind and generous; (4) toward animals, to be sparing and sympathetic; and (5) toward the devil, to be rejecting and separated. All God's people should practice these principles by the divine life.

chapter.verse: It is Jehovah whom you have today declared to be your God and that you will walk in His ways and keep His statutes and His commandments and His ordinances, and will listen to His voice.

verse.text: And it is Jehovah who has today declared you to be a people for His [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]personal treasure, even as He promised you; and that you will keep all His commandments;
verse.note: See note [link]5[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 19[/link].

verse.text: And that He will set you high [xref]a[/xref]above all the nations which He has made, for praise and for a name and for honor; and that you will be a [xref]b[/xref]holy people to Jehovah your God, as He has spoken.

chapter.verse: And Moses, with the elders of Israel, commanded the people, saying, Keep the whole commandment which I am commanding you today.

verse.text: And in the day when you [xref]a[/xref]cross over the Jordan into the land which Jehovah your God is giving you, you shall erect for yourself large stones; and you shall coat them with plaster.

And you shall [xref]a[/xref]write upon them [note]1[/note]all the words of this law when you cross over, in order that you may enter the land which Jehovah your God is giving you, a land flowing with [xref]b[/xref]milk and honey, as Jehovah, the God of your fathers, promised to you.
verse.note: Referring, probably, to the Ten Commandments.

verse.text: And when you cross over the Jordan, you shall erect these stones, concerning which I am commanding you today, on [xref]a[/xref]Mount Ebal; and you shall coat them with plaster.
[xref]a[/xref]And you shall build there an [note]1[/note]altar to Jehovah your God, an altar of stones; you shall not use an [note]2[/note]iron tool upon them;
verse.note: The children of Israel, being fallen in nature, surely would not measure up to keeping the commandments, statutes, and ordinances of their God; thus, they would come under all the curses listed in [link]vv. 15-26[/link]. However, right beside the stones containing the inscriptions of the commandments of God was the altar, signifying the cross of Christ, where God's people could take Christ, in type, as their burnt offering to God for His satisfaction and as their peace offering to God for their enjoyment with God in the divine fellowship ([link]vv. 6-7[/link]). Through Christ God's people, who were cursed under God's commandments, statutes, and ordinances, have been redeemed "out of the curse of the law" ([link]Gal. 3:13[/link]). Because we as God's people have come to the cross, we are now under the cross (implying grace) and are no longer under the law ([link]Rom. 6:14[/link]). As those who are under the cross, we can satisfy God and can also find satisfaction for ourselves through Christ, our Redeemer and our Substitute. Through Christ, who is our peace, we have peace with God ([link]Eph. 2:14a[/link]; [link]Rom. 5:1[/link]). The law is over, and the cross stands forever. This is the reason that the altar was prepared before the curses were declared.[br][br]The scene at the entry of the good land portrayed in [link]vv. 1-8[/link] includes the stone monuments, the altar, and the offerings. The law written on the monuments was a portrait of God Himself (see note [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 20[/link]); hence, the monuments signify that Christ as the embodiment of God was standing before the people to make requirements of them according to what He is. The offerings burned on the altar as sacrifices for God's satisfaction also signify Christ as the One who meets and satisfies all God's requirements. Thus, the requiring God Himself came in incarnation to be our Redeemer and our Substitute as the fulfilling One. This wonderful scene shows that it is through the requiring God, the cross of Christ, and Christ Himself as the offerings, not by our endeavoring in ourselves, that we enter into Christ, our good land, and receive all the blessings that God would give us in Christ. These blessings are the processed Triune God Himself embodied in Christ (see note [link]7[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link]).
See note [link]25[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 20[/link].

chapter.verse: With unhewn stones you shall build the altar of Jehovah your God. Then you shall offer up burnt offerings upon it to Jehovah your God;
And you shall sacrifice peace offerings and eat there, and you shall rejoice before Jehovah your God.

verse.text: Then you shall [xref]a[/xref]write upon the stones all the words of this law very clearly.

chapter.verse: And Moses, with the Levitical priests, spoke to all Israel, saying, Be silent and hear, O Israel; this day you have become the people of Jehovah your God.
Therefore you shall listen to the voice of Jehovah your God, and do His commandments and His statutes, which I am commanding you today.
And Moses commanded the people on that day, saying,

verse.text: These shall stand upon [xref]a[/xref]Mount Gerizim to bless the people when you cross over the Jordan: Simeon and Levi and Judah and Issachar and Joseph and Benjamin;
And these shall stand upon Mount Ebal for [xref]a[/xref]cursing: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

chapter.verse: And the Levites shall respond and say to all the men of Israel with a loud voice,

verse.text: Cursed is the man who [xref]a[/xref]makes an idol or a molten image, an abomination to Jehovah, the work of the craftsman's hands, and puts it in a secret place. And all the people shall answer and say, [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]Amen.
verse.note: An adjective in Hebrew meaning [i]firm, steadfast.[/i]

verse.text: Cursed is he who [xref]a[/xref]dishonors his father or his mother. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who moves his neighbor's [xref]a[/xref]boundary marker. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who leads astray a [xref]a[/xref]blind man on the way. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who distorts justice [i]due[/i] a [xref]a[/xref]sojourner, an orphan, or a widow. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who lies with his [xref]a[/xref]father's wife, for he uncovers the skirt of his father's garment. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who lies with any [xref]a[/xref]animal. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who lies with his [xref]a[/xref]sister, his father's daughter or his mother's daughter. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who lies with his [xref]a[/xref]mother-in-law. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who [xref]a[/xref]slays his neighbor secretly. And all the people shall say, Amen.
Cursed is he who [xref]a[/xref]takes payment to slay someone of innocent blood. And all the people shall say, Amen.
[xref]a[/xref]Cursed is he who does not confirm the words of this law by doing them. And all the people shall say, Amen.

And if you listen diligently to the voice of Jehovah your God and are certain to do all His commandments, which I am commanding you today, Jehovah your God will set you high [xref]a[/xref]above all the nations of the earth;

chapter.verse: And all these blessings will come upon you and overtake you if you listen to the voice of Jehovah your God.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Blessed shall you be in the city, and blessed shall you be in the field.
Blessed shall be the [xref]a[/xref]fruit of your womb and the fruit of your ground and the fruit of your animals, the offspring of your cattle and the young of your flock.

chapter.verse: Blessed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.

verse.text: Blessed shall you be when you [xref]a[/xref]come in, and blessed shall you be when you go out.
Jehovah will cause your enemies, who rise up against you, to be struck down before you; on one road they will come out against you, but on seven roads they will [xref]a[/xref]flee before you.
Jehovah will command the blessing upon you in your [xref]a[/xref]storehouses and in all your [xref]b[/xref]undertakings; and He will bless you in the land which Jehovah your God is giving you.
Jehovah will establish you as a [xref]a[/xref]holy people to Himself, as He swore to you, if you keep the commandments of Jehovah your God and walk in His ways.

chapter.verse: And all the peoples of the earth will see that you are called by Jehovah's name, and they will be afraid of you.

verse.text: And Jehovah will give you an excess of prosperity in the [xref]a[/xref]fruit of your womb and in the fruit of your animals and in the fruit of your ground, upon the ground which Jehovah swore to your fathers to give you.

Jehovah will open up to you His good treasury, the heavens, to give [xref]a[/xref]rain for your land in its season and to bless all your undertakings. And you will [xref]b[/xref]lend to many nations, but you will not borrow.

chapter.verse: And Jehovah will make you the head and not the tail, and you will tend only upward, and you will not tend downward, if you will listen to the commandments of Jehovah your God, which I am commanding you today to keep and to do.
And you shall not turn aside from any of the words which I am commanding you today, to the right or to the left, to go after other gods to serve them.

verse.text: But if you do [xref]a[/xref]not listen to the voice of Jehovah your God and are not certain to do all His commandments and His statutes, which I am commanding you today, all these [note]1[/note]curses will come upon you and overtake you.
verse.note: The curses in this chapter reveal that in His judgment God is severe ([link]Rom. 11:22[/link]). All the curses that have befallen the children of Israel have carried out God's governmental dealings in relation to them, so that through these dealings God would eventually be able to accomplish His economy with them to prove that He is the very God who would not change in His will forever. In His governmental dealing with His people, God is wise, loving, sympathetic, patient, purposeful, and successful. God's severe chastisement of the children of Israel does not mean that He has given them up ([link]Rom. 11:1-5[/link], [link]11-12[/link], [link]23-32[/link]). On the contrary, God is chastising them for their perfecting. The principle is the same with the New Testament believers ([link]Heb. 12:5-11[/link]).

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Cursed shall you be in the city, and cursed shall you be in the field.

chapter.verse: Cursed shall be your basket and your kneading bowl.
Cursed shall be the fruit of your womb and the fruit of your ground, the offspring of your cattle and the young of your flock.
Cursed shall you be when you come in, and cursed shall you be when you go out.

Jehovah will send to you cursing, discomfiture, and rebuke in all your undertakings which you do, until you are destroyed and until you perish quickly, because of the evil of your practices through which you have abandoned Me.
Jehovah will make a plague cling to you until He has consumed you from off the land which you are entering to possess.

verse.text: Jehovah will strike [i]you[/i] with [xref]a[/xref]consuming disease and fever and inflammation, and with burning heat and [note]1[/note]drought, and with blight and mildew; and [i]these[/i] will pursue you until you perish.
verse.note: Others read, sword.

verse.text: And your [xref]a[/xref]sky, which is above your head, will be bronze, and the land, which is under you, iron.

chapter.verse: Jehovah will make the rain of your land powder and dust; from heaven it will come down upon you until you are destroyed.

verse.text: Jehovah will cause you to be struck down before your enemies; on one road you will go out against them, but on seven roads you will [xref]a[/xref]flee before them. And you will be a [i]source of[/i] shuddering to all the kingdoms of the earth.
And your [xref]a[/xref]corpse will become food for all the birds of the sky and for the beasts of the earth; and no one will frighten [i]them[/i] away.
Jehovah will strike [i]you[/i] with the [xref]a[/xref]boils of Egypt, tumors, scabs, and itching, of which you cannot be healed.
Jehovah will strike [i]you[/i] with madness, [xref]a[/xref]blindness, and bewilderment of heart;

And you will be groping at noonday just as the [xref]a[/xref]blind man gropes in darkness; and you will not succeed in your ventures, but will only be oppressed and plundered always; and no one will save [i]you.[/i]
You will get engaged to a woman, but another man will ravish her; you will build a house, but you will not dwell in it; you will plant a vineyard, but you will not [note]1[/note]partake of it.
verse.note: Lit., bring it into common use (cf. [link]Lev. 19:23-25[/link]).

chapter.verse: Your ox will be slaughtered in your sight, but you will not eat of it; your donkey will be torn away from before you, but it will not be returned to you; your sheep will be given to your enemies, but no one will rescue [i]them[/i] for you.
Your sons and daughters will be given to another people while your eyes look on and fail [i]from longing[/i] after them all the day, but you will be powerless.
A people whom you have not known will eat the fruit of your ground and all your hard-earned produce, and you will be only oppressed and crushed always.
And you will go mad because of the sight [i]before[/i] your eyes which you will see.

verse.text: Jehovah will strike [i]you[/i] on the knees and legs with terrible [xref]a[/xref]boils, of which you cannot be healed, from the sole of your foot to the top of your head.

Jehovah will bring you and your king, whom you will have set over you, to a nation which you and your fathers have not known; and there you will [xref]a[/xref]serve other gods, [i]mere[/i] wood and stone.

chapter.verse: And you will become a [i]source of[/i] horror, a proverb, and a byword among all the peoples to whom Jehovah will drive you.

verse.text: You will put out much seed in the field, but you will harvest little; for the [xref]a[/xref]locust will consume it.

chapter.verse: You will plant vineyards and dress [i]them,[/i] but you will not drink the wine nor gather [i]the grapes;[/i] for the worm will devour them.
You will have olive trees in all your territory, but you will not anoint yourself with the oil; for your olives will drop off.

verse.text: You will beget sons and daughters, but they will not remain with you; for they will go into [xref]a[/xref]captivity.
The [xref]a[/xref]locust will take possession of all your trees and the fruit of your ground.

chapter.verse: The sojourner who is in your midst will rise above you higher and higher, but you will go down lower and lower.

verse.text: He will [xref]a[/xref]lend to you, and you will not lend to him; he will be the head and you will be the tail.

chapter.verse: And all these curses will come upon you and pursue you and overtake you until you are destroyed, because you did not listen to the voice of Jehovah your God, to keep His commandments and His statutes, which He commanded you;
And they will be with you and with your seed as a sign and wonder forever.

verse.text: Because you did [xref]a[/xref]not serve Jehovah your God with rejoicing and gladness of heart on account of the abundance of all things,

You will serve your enemies, whom Jehovah will send out against you, in hunger, in thirst, in nakedness, and in lack of all things; and He will put an iron [xref]a[/xref]yoke on your neck until He has destroyed you.

Jehovah will bring against you a nation from [xref]a[/xref]far away, from the end of the earth, like the [xref]b[/xref]eagle [i]that[/i] swoops down, a nation whose [xref]c[/xref]tongue you will not understand,
A nation of fierce countenance, who will not regard an [xref]a[/xref]old man's person nor show favor to the young man.

chapter.verse: And they will eat the fruit of your animals and the fruit of your ground until you are destroyed; they will not leave for you grain, new wine, or fresh oil, the offspring of your cattle or the young of your flock, until they cause you to perish.

verse.text: And they will [xref]a[/xref]besiege you in all your towns until your high and fortified walls, in which you trusted, come down throughout all your land; and they will besiege you in all your towns throughout all your land, which Jehovah your God has given you.

[xref]a[/xref]And you will eat the fruit of your womb, the flesh of your sons and daughters whom Jehovah your God has given you, in the siege and in the distress with which your enemies will distress you.

chapter.verse: The man who is delicately bred and luxurious among you, he will begrudge his brother, the wife of his bosom, and the remnant of his children whom he has left,

Not giving to one of them any of the flesh of his children whom he will eat; because nothing is left with him in the siege and in the distress with which your enemies will distress you in all your towns.

The delicately bred and luxurious woman among you, who does not venture to set the sole of her foot upon the ground because of [i]her[/i] luxuriousness and delicacy, she will begrudge the husband of her bosom and her son and daughter

The child who comes forth from her and her children whom she will bear; for she will eat them secretly for lack of all things in the siege and distress with which your enemy will distress you in your towns.
If you are not certain to do all the words of this law written in this book, that you may fear this glorious and awesome name — Jehovah your God —
Jehovah will make your plagues and the plagues of your seed extraordinary, great and persistent plagues, and malignant and persistent sicknesses.

verse.text: And He will put upon you again all the [xref]a[/xref]illnesses of Egypt, which you were afraid of, and they will cling to you.

chapter.verse: Also, every sickness and every plague which is not written in the book of this law, Jehovah will raise up upon you until you are destroyed.

verse.text: And you will be left few in number, whereas you were as the [xref]a[/xref]stars of heaven in multitude; for you did not listen to the voice of Jehovah your God.

chapter.verse: And as Jehovah exulted over you to do you good and to multiply you, so will Jehovah exult over you to make you perish and to destroy you; and you will be torn off the land which you are entering to possess.

verse.text: And Jehovah will [xref]a[/xref]scatter you among all the peoples, from one end of the earth to the other; and there you will [xref]b[/xref]serve other gods whom you and your fathers have not known, [i]mere[/i] wood and stone.

And among those nations you will have no rest, nor will there be a resting place for the sole of your foot; but Jehovah will give you there a quivering heart and eyes failing [i]with longing[/i] and a [xref]a[/xref]languishing soul.

chapter.verse: And your life will be hung in suspense before you, and you will dread night and day; and you will have no assurance of your life.

In the morning you will say, Oh that it were evening! and in the evening you will say, Oh that it were morning! because of your heart's dread with which you will dread and because of the sight [i]before[/i] your eyes which you will see.

verse.text: And Jehovah will bring you back to [xref]a[/xref]Egypt in ships, by the way concerning which I said to you, You shall never again see it. And there you will offer yourselves for sale to your enemies, as male slaves and as female slaves, but no one will buy [i]you.[/i]

These are the words of the [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]covenant which Jehovah commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]covenant that He made with them at Horeb.
verse.note: The covenant enacted in [link]chs. 29-30[/link] was the covenant which Jehovah commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, after the rehearsal of the law and the word of warning with the blessings and the curses. It was a covenant besides the one He made with them at Horeb, that is, at Mount Sinai. The warning was to remind the people, whereas the enactment of the covenant was to establish the warning.

verse.text: And Moses called to all Israel and said to them, You have [xref]a[/xref]seen all that Jehovah did before your eyes in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his servants, and to all his land,

chapter.verse: The great trials which your eyes have seen, those great signs and wonders.

verse.text: But Jehovah has [xref]a[/xref]not given you a [note]1[/note]heart to understand and eyes to see and ears to hear until this day.
verse.note: Because the children of Israel were rebellious in the wilderness, they were in darkness and thus did not understand what God was doing with them.

verse.text: And I have led you [xref]a[/xref]forty years in the wilderness; your [xref]b[/xref]clothing did not wear out from upon you, nor did your sandal wear out from upon your foot;
You have not eaten bread, nor have you drunk wine or strong drink; that you might [xref]a[/xref]know that I am Jehovah your God.
And when you came to this place, [xref]a[/xref]Sihon the king of Heshbon and Og the king of Bashan came out to meet us in battle, and we slew them;

chapter.verse: And we took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the Reubenites, to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of the Manassites.
Therefore keep the words of this covenant and do them in order that you may prosper in all that you do.

verse.text: You are standing today, all of you, before Jehovah your God, [note]1[/note]your leaders of your tribes, your elders, and your officers, every man of Israel,
verse.note: According to the reading of the Septuagint; the Hebrew text reads, your leaders, your tribes.

verse.text: Your little ones, your wives, and the sojourner with you, who is in the midst of your camp, from the [xref]a[/xref]man who chops your wood to the man who draws your water,
In order to enter into a covenant with Jehovah your God and into His [xref]a[/xref]oath, which Jehovah your God is making with you today,
So that He may establish you today as His people and that He may be your God, even as He has spoken to you and even as He [xref]a[/xref]swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
However not with you alone do I make this [xref]a[/xref]covenant and this oath;

chapter.verse: But [i]I make it[/i] with him who is here today standing with us before Jehovah our God and with him who is not here with us today.
For you know that we dwelt in the land of Egypt and that we passed through the midst of the nations whom you passed through,
And you saw their detestable [i]images[/i] and their idols, [i]mere[/i] wood and stone, silver and gold, which were with them.

verse.text: [i]Beware[/i] that there is not among you any man or woman or family or tribe whose heart turns away, [i]even[/i] today, from Jehovah our God, to go and serve the [note]1[/note]gods of those nations; that there is not among you a [note]2[/note][xref]a[/xref]root bearing poisonous fruit and wormwood;
verse.note: God's unique concern regarding Israel was that they would turn away from Him and serve idols ([link]Jer. 2:13[/link]; cf. [link]1 John 5:21[/link]). This would be an insult to God, and it would cause Him to punish the people severely.
The root here refers to a rebellious person who rises up from among the people, similar to those mentioned in [link]Acts 20:30[/link].

verse.text: And [i]that[/i] when he hears the words of this [note]1[/note]oath, he blesses himself in his heart, saying, I will have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart; [note]2[/note]to the ruin of the moist with the dry.
verse.note: Or, curse. So also in [link]vv. 20[/link] and [link]21[/link].
A Hebrew idiom indicating destruction of everything in his path.

chapter.verse: Jehovah will not be willing to pardon him; but rather the anger of Jehovah and His jealousy will fume against that man, and all the oath that is written in this book will settle on him, and Jehovah will blot out his name from under heaven.
And Jehovah will separate him unto evil out of all the tribes of Israel according to all the oaths of the covenant written in this book of the law.

And the following generation, your children who will rise up after you and the foreigner who will come from a distant land, will say, when they see the plagues of that land and its diseases with which Jehovah has made it sick;

verse.text: [i]And that[/i] all its land is sulfur and salt, a burning waste; [i]that[/i] it is not sown, nor does it sprout, nor does any vegetation come up in it; [i]that[/i] it is like the overthrow of [xref]a[/xref]Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which Jehovah overthrew in His anger and burning wrath —
Indeed all the nations will say, [xref]a[/xref]Why has Jehovah done this to this land? Why the burning of this great anger?

chapter.verse: And they will say, [i]It is[/i] because they forsook the covenant of Jehovah, the God of their fathers, which He made with them when He brought them out from the land of Egypt;
And they went and served other gods and bowed down to them, gods whom they had not known and He had not allotted to them.

verse.text: And the anger of Jehovah burned against this land, bringing upon it all the [xref]a[/xref]curses written in this book;
And Jehovah [xref]a[/xref]plucked them off their land in anger and in burning wrath and in great indignation, and sent them to another land, as they are this day.
The things that are [note]1[/note]hidden belong to Jehovah our God; but the things that are [note]1[/note]revealed, to us and our children forever, that we may do all the words of this law.
verse.note: This indicates that we should take care of the revealed things and not seek the hidden things. For the children of Israel here, the things revealed were the law, the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances. They were to take care of these things so that they might do all the words of the law.

verse.text: And [note]1[/note]when all these things come upon you, the blessing and the curse, which I have [xref]a[/xref]set before you; and you bring [i]them[/i] to heart [i]while[/i] among the nations to whom Jehovah your God will drive you;
verse.note: The promise in [link]vv. 1-10[/link] is a prophecy that will be fulfilled at the time of the restoration, at the Lord's second coming ([link]Matt. 24:30-31[/link]).

verse.text: And you and your children [xref]a[/xref]return to Jehovah your God and listen to His voice, according to all that I am commanding you today, with all your heart and with all your soul;

Then Jehovah your God will [xref]a[/xref]turn your captivity and be compassionate to you, and He will turn and [xref]b[/xref]gather you from all the peoples among whom Jehovah your God has scattered you.
[xref]a[/xref]If any of you have been driven out to the ends of heaven, from there will Jehovah your God [xref]b[/xref]gather you and from there will He take you.

chapter.verse: And Jehovah your God will bring you into the land which your fathers possessed, and you will possess it; and He will do good for you and will multiply you more than [i]He did[/i] your fathers.

verse.text: And Jehovah your God will circumcise your [xref]a[/xref]heart and the heart of your seed, so that you will [xref]b[/xref]love Jehovah your God with all your heart and with all your soul, that you may live.
And Jehovah your God will put all these [note]1[/note]oaths upon your enemies and upon them who hate you [i]and[/i] who have persecuted you.
verse.note: Or, curses.

chapter.verse: And you will turn and listen to the voice of Jehovah, and you will do all His commandments, which I am commanding you today.

And Jehovah your God will give you an excess of prosperity in all your undertakings, in the fruit of your womb and in the fruit of your animals and in the fruit of your ground, for Jehovah will again exult over you for good as He exulted over your fathers;

If you listen to the voice of Jehovah your God, to keep His commandments and His statutes written in this book of the law; if you turn back to Jehovah your God with all your heart and with all your soul.

verse.text: For this commandment which I am commanding you today, it is not too [note]1[/note]difficult for you, nor is it distant.
verse.note: Or, extraordinary; wonderful.

verse.text: [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]It is not in heaven that you should say, Who will ascend to heaven for us and bring it to us to make us hear it and do it?
verse.note: In [link]Rom. 10:6-8[/link] Paul applies the word spoken by Moses in [link]vv. 11-14[/link] to Christ, indicating that the commandment, which is the word of God ([link]vv. 11[/link], [link]14[/link]), is Christ as the Word ([link]John 1:1[/link]; [link]Rev. 19:13[/link]), who, as the breath that proceeds out of God's mouth (cf. [link]8:3[/link]; [link]2 Tim. 3:16a[/link]), is in our heart and in our mouth (see note [link]8[sup]1[/sup] in Rom. 10[/link]). As the Word of God, the incarnated, crucified, and resurrected Christ Himself, who has become the life-giving Spirit as the breath breathed out by the speaking God ([link]1 Cor. 15:45[/link]; [link]John 20:22[/link]), is the word of the law — including the commandments, the statutes, and the ordinances (judgments) — rehearsed by Moses in this book. Thus, every word in this book is the very Christ, who is now the word of God for us to receive as our life and life supply by calling on Him ([link]Rom. 10:12-13[/link]). See notes [link]3[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link] and [link]9[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 119[/link].

verse.text: Nor is it across the [note]1[/note]sea that you should say, Who will go across the sea for us and bring it to us to make us hear it and do it?
verse.note: Whereas this verse speaks of the sea, in [link]Rom. 10:7[/link] Paul speaks of the abyss. The sea is the mouth of the abyss. See notes [link]7[sup]1[/sup] in Rom. 10[/link] and [link]1[sup]2[/sup] in Rev. 13[/link].

chapter.verse: But the word is very near to you, [i]even[/i] in your mouth and in your heart, that you may do it.

verse.text: See, I have [xref]a[/xref]put before you today life and good, and death and evil.

[note]1[/note][i]If you obey the commandments of Jehovah your God,[/i] which I am commanding you today, to love Jehovah your God and walk in His ways and keep His commandments and His statutes and His ordinances, then you will live and multiply, and Jehovah your God will bless you in the land which you are entering to possess.
verse.note: The supplied words are from the Septuagint and do not appear in the Hebrew text.

chapter.verse: But if your heart turns and you do not listen, but rather you are drawn away in worship to other gods and serve them,
I declare to you today that you shall surely perish; your days will not be extended upon the land into which you are crossing over the Jordan to go and possess.

verse.text: I call [xref]a[/xref]heaven and earth to witness against you today: I have [xref]b[/xref]set before you life and death, blessing and curse; therefore choose life that you and your seed may live,

In loving Jehovah your God by listening to His voice and [xref]a[/xref]holding fast to Him; for [note]1[/note]He is your [xref]b[/xref]life and the length of your days, that you may dwell upon the land which Jehovah [xref]c[/xref]swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, to give them.
verse.note: Or, that.

verse.text: When Moses [note]1[/note]finished speaking these words to all Israel,
verse.note: According to some MSS and ancient versions; other MSS read, went and spoke.

verse.text: He said to them, I am a [xref]a[/xref]hundred and twenty years old today; I can no longer [xref]b[/xref]go out and come in, and Jehovah has said to me, [xref]c[/xref]You shall not cross over this Jordan.

It is Jehovah your God who is [xref]a[/xref]crossing over before you; it is He who will destroy these nations from before you, and you will dispossess them. [xref]b[/xref]Joshua is the one who is crossing over before you, as Jehovah has spoken.
And Jehovah will do to them even as He did to [xref]a[/xref]Sihon and [xref]b[/xref]Og, the kings of the Amorites, and to their land when He destroyed them.
And Jehovah will [xref]a[/xref]deliver them up before you, and you will do to them according to the whole commandment, which I have commanded you.

[xref]a[/xref]Be strong and take courage; do [xref]b[/xref]not fear, neither be terrified of them, for it is Jehovah your God who goes [xref]c[/xref]with you; He will [xref]d[/xref]not fail you nor forsake you.

And Moses called Joshua and said to him in the sight of all Israel, [xref]a[/xref]Be strong and take courage, for you will go with this people into the land which Jehovah swore to their fathers to give them; and you will cause them to inherit it.
But it is Jehovah who is going [xref]a[/xref]before you. He will be with you; He will [xref]b[/xref]not fail you nor forsake you. Do [xref]c[/xref]not fear, neither be dismayed.

chapter.verse: And Moses wrote this law and gave it to the priests, the sons of Levi, who bear the Ark of the Covenant of Jehovah, and to all the elders of Israel.

verse.text: And Moses commanded them, saying, At the end of [i]every[/i] [xref]a[/xref]seven years, at the appointed time of the year of release, at the Feast of [note]1[/note]Tabernacles,
verse.note: Lit., Booths. See note [link]16[sup]2[/sup] in Exo. 23[/link].

verse.text: When all Israel comes to [xref]a[/xref]appear before Jehovah your God in the place which He will choose, you shall read this law before all Israel in their hearing.

chapter.verse: Gather the people, the men, the women, and the little ones, and the sojourner with you, who is within your gates, that they may hear and that they may learn to fear Jehovah your God and be certain to do all the words of this law,

verse.text: And [i]that[/i] their [xref]a[/xref]children, who have not known [i]these things,[/i] may hear and learn to fear Jehovah your God all the days that you live upon the land into which you are crossing over the Jordan to possess.

And Jehovah said to Moses, Now your days draw near for you to [xref]a[/xref]die. Call [xref]b[/xref]Joshua and present yourselves in the Tent of Meeting that I may charge him. So Moses went with Joshua, and they presented themselves in the Tent of Meeting.
And Jehovah appeared in the tent in a pillar of [xref]a[/xref]cloud; and the pillar of cloud stood over the entrance of the tent.

And Jehovah said to Moses, You are now about to lie down with your fathers; and this people will rise up and go as harlots after the strange gods of the land, into the midst of which they are entering; and they will forsake Me and break My [xref]a[/xref]covenant which I made with them.

And My anger will burn against them in that day, and I will forsake them and [xref]a[/xref]hide My face from them; and they will be devoured, and many evils and troubles will befall them, so that they will say in that day, Is it not because our God is not in our midst that these evils have befallen us?

chapter.verse: And I will surely hide My face in that day because of all the evil which they have done, for they turned to other gods.

verse.text: And now write for yourselves this [xref]a[/xref]song and teach it to the children of Israel; put it in their mouth that I may have this song as a witness against the children of Israel.

For I will bring them into the land which I swore to their fathers, [i]a land[/i] flowing with [xref]a[/xref]milk and honey, and they will eat and become [xref]b[/xref]satisfied and [xref]c[/xref]grow fat, and they will turn to other gods and serve them and despise Me and break My covenant.

chapter.verse: And when many evils and troubles befall them, this song will respond as a witness before them, because it will not be forgotten in the mouth of their seed; for I know their intention, which they are making even today before I bring them into the land which I have sworn [i]to them.[/i]
So Moses wrote this song on that day and taught it to the children of Israel.

verse.text: And He charged [xref]a[/xref]Joshua the son of Nun and said, Be strong and take courage, for you will bring the children of Israel into the land which I have sworn to them; and I will be with you.

chapter.verse: And when Moses finished writing the words of this law in a book until they were completed,
Moses charged the Levites who bear the Ark of the Covenant of Jehovah, saying,

verse.text: Take this [xref]a[/xref]book of the law and place it at the side of the Ark of the Covenant of Jehovah your God, that it may be there as a witness against you.

For I know your [note]1[/note]rebelliousness and your [note]1[/note]stiff neck: See, while I am yet here alive with you today, you have been rebelling against Jehovah; so how much more after my death!
verse.note: What is portrayed in [link]vv. 27-29[/link] concerning the rebelliousness and stubbornness of the children of Israel should cause us not to have any trust in ourselves, for we are the same in nature as they. Therefore, we surely need the Lord's mercy and grace. We need to continually come to the Lord and receive Him as the word into our being (see notes [link]3[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 8[/link] and [link]12[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 30[/link]).[br][br]Israel's stubbornness is in contrast to God's sovereignty for the showing forth of God's wisdom and for the accomplishing of God's economy ([link]Rom. 9-11[/link]).

verse.text: Gather to me all the elders of your tribes and your officers, that I may speak in their hearing these words and that I may call [xref]a[/xref]heaven and earth to witness against them;

For I know that [xref]a[/xref]after my death you will utterly spoil yourselves and turn away from the way that I have commanded you; and evil will come upon you in the last days, for you will do what is evil in the sight of Jehovah so as to provoke Him to anger by your undertakings.

chapter.verse: And Moses spoke in the hearing of all the congregation of Israel the words of this song until they were completed.

verse.text: Give ear, O [xref]a[/xref]heaven, and let me speak; / And let the earth hear the words of my mouth.
Let my teaching drop like the [xref]a[/xref]rain; / Let my speech distill like the dew, / Like raindrops upon tender grass, / And like abundant [xref]b[/xref]showers upon herbage.

chapter.verse: For the name of Jehovah will I declare. / Ascribe greatness to our God!

verse.text: The [xref]a[/xref]Rock — perfect is His work, / For all His [xref]b[/xref]ways are justice: / A God of faithfulness and without injustice; / Righteous and upright is He.
Corruptly have [i]they[/i] dealt with Him — their blemish is not His [note]1[/note]sons — / A twisted and [xref]a[/xref]crooked generation [i]are they.[/i]
verse.note: The children of Israel were to be God's sons ([link]Exo. 4:22[/link]), but in their living they did not behave as God's sons. Instead, they were twisted and crooked.

verse.text: Do you repay Jehovah with this, / Foolish and unwise people? / Is He not your [xref]a[/xref]Father who bought you? / Was it not He who [xref]b[/xref]made you and established you?

chapter.verse: Remember the days of long ago; / Consider the years of generation upon generation; / Ask your father, and he will inform you; / Your elders, and they will tell you.

verse.text: When the [xref]a[/xref]Most High gave the nations [i]their[/i] inheritance, / When He [xref]b[/xref]divided the sons of [note]1[/note]man, / He set the [xref]c[/xref]borders of the peoples / According to the number of Israel's children.
verse.note: Or, Adam.

verse.text: For Jehovah's portion is His people; / Jacob is the allotment of His [xref]a[/xref]inheritance.
He found him in a land of [xref]a[/xref]wilderness, / And in a howling desert waste; / He encircled him, cared for him with all attention; / He guarded him like the [xref]b[/xref]pupil of His eye.
As the [xref]a[/xref]eagle rouses his nest, / Hovers over his young, / Spreads his [xref]b[/xref]wings, takes them, / [i]And[/i] bears them up upon his pinions;
[i]So[/i] Jehovah alone [xref]a[/xref]led him, / And there was [xref]b[/xref]no strange god with Him.

He made him ride on the [xref]a[/xref]high places of the earth, / And he ate the produce of the field; / And He made him suck [xref]b[/xref]honey out of a crag, / And [xref]c[/xref]oil out of flint rock:

Curd of cows and milk of sheep, / With fat of lambs, / And rams, the offspring of Bashan, and goats, / With the choicest [xref]a[/xref]wheat; / And the [xref]b[/xref]blood of the grape you drank as fermenting wine.

But [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]Jeshurun grew fat and kicked — / You have become [xref]b[/xref]fat, you have grown thick, you have gorged yourself — / And forsook God, who made him, / And treated the [xref]c[/xref]Rock of his salvation disdainfully.
verse.note: From the Hebrew root meaning [i]upright.[/i]

verse.text: They made Him [xref]a[/xref]jealous with strange [i]gods;[/i] / With abominations they provoked Him to anger.

They sacrificed to [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]demons, [i]to those who were[/i] no god, / [i]To[/i] gods they did not know, / [i]To[/i] new ones who had recently come up, / Before whom your fathers had not shuddered.
verse.note: See notes on [link]1 Cor. 10:20[/link].

verse.text: You have neglected the [xref]a[/xref]Rock who begot you / And have forgotten the God who travailed with you.
And Jehovah saw and held [i]them[/i] in contempt, / Because of anger provoked by His [xref]a[/xref]sons and daughters.
And He said, I will [xref]a[/xref]hide My face from them; / I will see what their latter end will be. / For they are a generation of perversions, / Children in whom is no faithfulness.

They have made Me [xref]a[/xref]jealous with a non-God; / They have provoked Me to anger with their [note]1[/note][xref]b[/xref]vanities. / Hence I will make them [xref]c[/xref]jealous with a [xref]d[/xref]non-people; / With a foolish nation I will provoke them to anger.
verse.note: The word frequently refers to idols (cf. [link]Jer. 8:19[/link]).

verse.text: For a [xref]a[/xref]fire is kindled in My anger / And burns unto nethermost [note]1[/note]Sheol. / And it devours the earth and its produce / And sets ablaze the foundations of the mountains.
verse.note: See note [link]23[sup]1[/sup] in Matt. 11[/link].

verse.text: I will heap evils on them; / I will use up My [xref]a[/xref]arrows against them.

chapter.verse: They shall be sucked up by famine, / And eaten up by fire bolt / And bitter destruction; / And I will send the teeth of beasts against them, / With the venom of those that crawl in the dust.
The sword shall bereave outside, / And inside, terror; / [i]Taking[/i] both the young man and the virgin, / The suckling with the gray-haired man.

verse.text: I would have said, I will [xref]a[/xref]scatter them, / I will cause the memory of them to cease from among men;

chapter.verse: Except I dreaded the vexation from the enemy; / Lest their adversaries misjudge; / Lest they say, Our hand is exalted, / And [i]it is[/i] not Jehovah [i]who[/i] has wrought all this.

verse.text: For they are a nation destitute of counsel, / And there is [xref]a[/xref]no understanding in them.
If they had been wise, they would have comprehended [xref]a[/xref]this, / They would have perceived their latter end.
How shall [xref]a[/xref]one chase a thousand, / And two put ten thousand to flight, / Were it not that their Rock sold them, / And Jehovah delivered them up?
For their rock is not like our [xref]a[/xref]Rock; / And [i]of this[/i] our enemies are judges.

chapter.verse: For their vine is from Sodom's vine, / And from Gomorrah's fields; / Their grapes are the grapes of poison; / Clusters of bitterness have they.
Their wine is the venom of serpents / And the cruel poison of cobras.
Is this not laid up in store with Me, / Sealed up in My treasuries?

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Vengeance is Mine and [i]so[/i] is retribution, / For the time when their foot slips; / Because the day of their calamity has drawn near, / And the things destined to happen to them hasten.

[xref]a[/xref]For Jehovah will [note]1[/note]execute judgment for His people, / And He will have compassion on His servants, / When He sees that [i]their[/i] support is gone, / And that neither fettered nor free remain.
verse.note: Or, judge His people.

verse.text: And He will say, [xref]a[/xref]Where are their gods, / The rock they sought refuge in,
Who ate the fat of their sacrifices, / And drank the wine of their drink offering? / Let them rise up and help you; / Let [note]1[/note]them be a shelter over you.
verse.note: According to the Septuagint and the other ancient versions; the Hebrew text reads, Let there be a shelter over you.

verse.text: See now that I, I am He, / And there is no god with Me.[br/]It is I who kill, and I [xref]a[/xref]make alive; / I wound, and it is I who [xref]b[/xref]heal; / [xref]c[/xref]And there is no one who can deliver from My hand.
For I [xref]a[/xref]lift up My hand to heaven / And say, As I [xref]b[/xref]live forever:

chapter.verse: If I sharpen My flashing sword, / And My hand takes hold of judgment, / I will repay My adversaries with vengeance, / And those who hate Me will I recompense.

verse.text: I will make My arrows drunk with blood, / And My sword will devour flesh — / With the blood of the slain and of the captives, / [i]The flesh[/i] of the long-haired [note]1[/note]leaders of the enemy.
verse.note: Or, heads.

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Shout [note]1[/note]joyously, you nations, [i]with[/i] His people, / Because He will [xref]b[/xref]avenge the blood of His servants, / And He will repay His adversaries with vengeance / And will cover [i]the guilt[/i] of His land [i]and[/i] of His people.
verse.note: Many things in the song of Moses are severe, but the ending is very positive. No matter how evil the children of Israel might be and no matter how much God might be provoked in His anger toward them, the result, the issue, will be good. Instead of forsaking His people, God will eventually come in to vindicate them ([link]Isa. 2:2-3[/link]; [link]Zech. 8:20-23[/link]). This is true concerning Israel and also concerning the believers in Christ.

verse.text: And Moses came and spoke all the words of this song in the hearing of the people, he and [xref]a[/xref]Hoshea the son of Nun.

chapter.verse: And Moses finished speaking all these words to all Israel.

verse.text: And he said to them, Set your heart on all these words which I am testifying to you today. You shall command them to your [xref]a[/xref]children that they may be certain to do all the words of this law.
For it is not a matter too vain for you, because it is your [xref]a[/xref]life; and by this matter you will extend your days upon the land into which you are crossing over the Jordan to possess.

chapter.verse: And Jehovah spoke to Moses that same day, saying,

verse.text: [xref]a[/xref]Go up to this mountain of the Abarim, Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, which faces Jericho, and see the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the children of Israel as a possession;

chapter.verse: And die in the mountain to which you are going up, and be gathered to your people, just as Aaron your brother died in Mount Hor and was gathered to his people;

verse.text: Because [note]1[/note]you were unfaithful to Me among the children of Israel at the waters of Meribah-kadesh, in the wilderness of Zin; because [note]1[/note]you did not [note]2[/note]sanctify Me among the children of Israel.
verse.note: Plural in Hebrew.
See note [link]12[sup]1[/sup] in Num. 20[/link].

verse.text: But from a distance you shall [xref]a[/xref]see the land, yet you shall [note]1[/note]not go there into the land which I am giving to the children of Israel.
verse.note: See note [link]26[sup]1[/sup] in ch. 3[/link].

verse.text: And this is the [note]1[/note]blessing with which Moses, the [xref]a[/xref]man of God, blessed the children of Israel before his death.
verse.note: Ultimately, this book shows us that the love of God consummately works for His people that they may enjoy His full blessing according to His will and foreknowledge. In spite of the failure of God's people in loving God and fearing Him and in spite of their unfaithfulness, God will be faithful to the end ([link]2 Tim. 2:13[/link]), and eventually He will accomplish His intention that His people may enjoy His full blessing. God's chosen people eventually entered into the Holy Land, possessed it, lived in it, and enjoyed it. This corresponds with the revelation of the entire Bible, which shows that in spite of the unfaithfulness, defeat, and failure of God's people, God will still enable His chosen people to enter into the rich Christ to possess Him, enjoy Him, experience Him, and even live Him (cf. [link]Phil. 3:7-14[/link]; [link]1:19-21[/link]). This is God's success, and the boast and glory belong to no one other than Him.

verse.text: And he said,[br/]Jehovah came from [xref]a[/xref]Sinai, / And He dawned upon them from Seir; / He shined forth from Mount Paran, / And He approached from the [xref]b[/xref]myriads of holy ones; / From His right hand a fiery [xref]c[/xref]law [i]went[/i] out to them.
Indeed, He [xref]a[/xref]loves the people. / All His [xref]b[/xref]saints were in Your hand, / And they sat down at Your [xref]c[/xref]feet; / [i]Everyone[/i] receives of Your words.
[xref]a[/xref]Moses commanded us a law, / A possession of the congregation of Jacob.
And He was King in [xref]a[/xref]Jeshurun, / When the heads of the people gathered themselves, / The tribes of Israel together.
[xref]a[/xref]May [note]1[/note]Reuben live and not die, / Nor his men be few.
verse.note: Concerning Moses' blessing of the twelve tribes of Israel in [link]vv. 6-25[/link], see notes on Jacob's blessing in [link]Gen. 49:3-28[/link]. Moses' blessing here on Reuben was the blessing of increase.

verse.text: And this [i]is the blessing[/i] concerning Judah; and he said,[br/]Hear, O Jehovah, the voice of Judah, / And [note]1[/note]bring him to his people. / With his hands he contended for them; / And may You be a help against his [note]2[/note]adversaries.
verse.note: Since Judah was a tribe accustomed to fighting for the people, this prayer of Moses' for Judah was a prayer for Judah to be brought back to his people from the battlefield.
Enemies come from the outside, whereas adversaries arise from within. Cf. note [link]9[sup]4[/sup] in Rev. 12[/link].

verse.text: And concerning Levi he said,[br/]May Your Thummim and [xref]a[/xref]Urim be with [note]1[/note]Your faithful man, / Whom You tested at Massah, / [i]With whom[/i] You contended at the waters of [xref]b[/xref]Meribah —
verse.note: Or, the man of Your lovingkindness.

verse.text: He who said of his [xref]a[/xref]father and mother, / I do not [note]1[/note]regard him; / And his [xref]b[/xref]brothers he did not acknowledge, / And his children he did not recognize; / For they have kept Your speaking / And have guarded Your [xref]c[/xref]covenant.
verse.note: See note [link]27[sup]1[/sup] in Exo. 32[/link].

verse.text: They shall show Jacob Your ordinances, / And Israel Your law; / They shall put [xref]a[/xref]incense before Your nostrils / And whole [i]burnt[/i] offerings upon Your altar.

Bless, O Jehovah, his [note]1[/note]might, / And the work of his hands accept; / Wound thoroughly the loins of those who rise up against him / And of those who hate him, that they may not rise up [i]again.[/i]
verse.note: Or, substance.

verse.text: Concerning Benjamin he said,[br/]The beloved of Jehovah shall dwell securely beside Him; / [i]Jehovah[/i] shall cover over him all the day, / And He shall [xref]a[/xref]dwell between his shoulders.

And concerning Joseph he said,[br/]May his land be [xref]a[/xref]blessed of Jehovah / With the choicest things of heaven, with the [xref]b[/xref]dew / And with the deep [i]waters[/i] that couch beneath;
With the choicest of the crops of the sun, / And with the choicest of the yield of the [note]1[/note]moons;
verse.note: I.e., months.

verse.text: With the top of the ancient [xref]a[/xref]mountains, / And with the choicest things of the eternal hills;

With the choicest things of the earth, and the fullness thereof, / And the favor of Him who dwelt in the [xref]a[/xref]thornbush. / May they come upon the head of Joseph, / And upon the top of the head of him who is separated among his brothers.

[i]Like[/i] his firstborn ox, he has majesty; / And his horns are the [xref]a[/xref]horns of the wild ox; / With them he shall drive peoples / [i]To[/i] the ends of the earth together. / Those are the ten thousands of [note]1[/note]Ephraim; / And those the thousands of [note]1[/note]Manasseh.
verse.note: See note [link]5[sup]1[/sup] in Gen. 48[/link].

verse.text: And concerning Zebulun he said,[br/]Rejoice, Zebulun, for your [note]1[/note]going forth, / And Issachar, for your tents!
verse.note: This going forth was fulfilled in the Lord's sending forth the apostles ([link]Matt. 28:16-20[/link]). Most of the apostles, who were sent forth to disciple the nations, came forth from the land of Zebulun, which was in the region of Galilee ([link]Matt. 4:12-23[/link]).

verse.text: They shall call peoples to the [xref]a[/xref]mountain; / There they shall offer sacrifices of righteousness; / For they shall suck the abundance of the seas / And the hidden treasures of the sand.

chapter.verse: And concerning Gad he said,[br/]Blessed be He who enlarges Gad. / He dwells as a lioness, / And tears off the arm, yea, even the top of the head.

verse.text: And he provided the [xref]a[/xref]first part for himself, / For there the portion of a [note]1[/note]lawgiver is reserved; / And he came with the heads of the people; / He executed the righteousness of Jehovah / And His judgments with Israel.
verse.note: Or, commander.

verse.text: And concerning Dan he said,[br/]Dan is a lion's whelp / That leaps forth from [xref]a[/xref]Bashan.
And concerning Naphtali he said,[br/]O Naphtali, satisfied with favor, / And full of the blessing of Jehovah: / Possess the [xref]a[/xref]sea and the south.
And concerning Asher he said,[br/]Blessed be Asher above the sons. / May he be the one favored of his brothers, / And the one dipping his foot in [note]1[/note]oil.
verse.note: For Asher to dip his foot in oil means that he would be rich in the produce of the earth.

chapter.verse: Your doorbolts shall be iron and copper; / And as your days are, so shall your strength be.

verse.text: There is no one like the God of [xref]a[/xref]Jeshurun, / Who [xref]b[/xref]rides through the heavens as your help / And in His majesty through the skies.
The God of old is [i]your[/i] [note]1[/note][xref]a[/xref]habitation, / And underneath are eternal arms. / And He drove out the enemy before you / And said, Destroy!
verse.note: Moses' word here and his word in [link]Psa. 90:1[/link] indicate that while he was traveling in the wilderness with the children of Israel for forty years, in his deep feeling he was dwelling in God. See note [link]1[sup]1[/sup] in Psa. 90[/link].

chapter.verse: So Israel dwelt securely, / The fountain of Jacob in solitude, / On a land of grain and new wine; / And the heavens over him drop [i]their[/i] dew.

verse.text: Happy are you, O Israel; who is [xref]a[/xref]like you? / A people [xref]b[/xref]saved by Jehovah, / The shield of your [xref]c[/xref]help / And [i]He[/i] who is the sword of your majesty! / So your enemies shall come cringing to you, / And you shall tread upon their high places.
Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount [xref]a[/xref]Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which faces Jericho. And Jehovah showed him all the land: Gilead as far as Dan;
And all of Naphtali; and the land of Ephraim and Manasseh; and all the land of Judah as far as the [xref]a[/xref]sea beyond [i]it;[/i]

chapter.verse: And the Negev; and the Plain, [i]that is,[/i] the valley of Jericho, the city of palm trees, as far as Zoar.

verse.text: And Jehovah said to him, [xref]a[/xref]This is the land which I swore to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, saying, To your [xref]b[/xref]seed I will give it. I have let you see it with your [i]own[/i] eyes, but you will not go over there.
So [xref]a[/xref]Moses the servant of Jehovah died there in the land of Moab according to the word of Jehovah.
And [note]1[/note]He buried him in the valley in the land of Moab opposite Beth-peor; but no man knows his burial site to this day.
verse.note: God buried Moses for a particular purpose, that Moses may be one of the two witnesses in [link]Rev. 11[/link] (see note [link book="Rev." chapter="11"]3[sup]2[/sup][/link] there). See note [link]3[sup]1[/sup] in Matt. 17[/link].

verse.text: And Moses was a [xref]a[/xref]hundred and twenty years old when he died; his eye was not [xref]b[/xref]dim, nor had his freshness left [i]him.[/i]
And the children of Israel wept for Moses in the plains of Moab for [xref]a[/xref]thirty days; thus, the days of weeping [i]and[/i] mourning for Moses were completed.

And [note]1[/note]Joshua the son of Nun was filled with the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had [note]2[/note][xref]a[/xref]laid his hands upon him; and the children of Israel listened to him and did as Jehovah had commanded Moses.
verse.note: Meaning [i]Jehovah Savior,[/i] or [i]the salvation of Jehovah[/i] ([link]Num. 13:16[/link]). The Greek form of the name is [i]Jesus.[/i]
See note [link]14[sup]4[/sup] in 1 Tim. 4[/link].

verse.text: And there has not arisen a [xref]a[/xref]prophet since then in Israel like Moses, whom Jehovah knew [xref]b[/xref]face to face,
For all the [xref]a[/xref]signs and the wonders which Jehovah sent him to do in the land of Egypt, to Pharaoh, to all his servants, and to all his land,

chapter.verse: And for all the mighty power and for all the great terror which Moses did in the sight of all Israel.
